translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said unto him: shall I follow thee that thou mayest teach me of that which thou hast been taught a directive knowledge.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said to him (Khidr) "May I follow you so that you teach me something of that knowledge (guidance and true path) which you have been taught (by Allah)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said to him, “May I follow you, so that you may teach me some of the guidance you were taught?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said to him: "May l follow you that you may teach me something of the wisdom which you have been taught?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said to him: "May I follow you so that you teach me something of that knowledge which you have been taught (by Allah)"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said unto him: May I follow thee, to the end that thou mayst teach me right conduct of that which thou hast been taught?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said to him, ‘May I follow you for the purpose that you teach me some of the probity you have been taught?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said to him: 'May I follow you so that you can teach me of that you have learned of righteousness'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses asked him, "Can I follow you so that you would teach me the guidance that you have received?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Musa said to him: Shall I follow you on condition that you should teach me right knowledge of what you have been taught?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said to him, "May I follow you, so that you may guide me by what you have been taught?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said to him: "May I follow thee, on the footing that thou teach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been taught?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Commemorate Moses in the Book. He was a chosen one, both an apostle and a prophet.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And mention in the Book Moses; he was devoted, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And mention thou in the Book Musa: verily he was single- hearted, and was an apostle, prophet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And mention in the Book (this Quran) Musa (Moses). Verily! He was chosen and he was a Messenger (and) a Prophet.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And mention in the Scripture Moses. He was dedicated. He was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recite in the Book the account of Moses. He was a chosen one, a Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Musa. Verily, he was Mukhlasan and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed he was exclusively dedicated [to Allah], and an apostle and prophet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Mention in the Book, Moses. He was devoted, a Messenger, and a Prophet.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Moses. Moses was a sincere person, a Messengers and a Prophet.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And mention Musa in the Book; surely he was one purified, and he was an apostle, a prophet.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell also of Moses in the Book. He was indeed a chosen one, and was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: What is that in your right band, O Moses?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: What is that, Moses, thou hast in thy right hand?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And what is that in thy right hand, O Musa!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And what is that in your right hand, O Musa (Moses)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And what is that in your right-hand, O Moses?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And what is in your right hand, O Moses?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And what is that in your right hand, O Musa"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Moses, what is that in your right hand?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: What is that in your right hand, Moses'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Lord asked, "Moses, what is in your right hand?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And what is this in your right hand, O Musa!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "What do you have in your right hand, Moses?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And what is that in the right hand, O Moses?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Throw it down, O Moses," said (the Voice).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said He, 'Cast it down, Moses!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Allah said: cast it down, O Musa!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (Allah) said: "Cast it down, O Musa (Moses)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Throw it, O Moses.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Moses, throw it down."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Allah) said: "Cast it down, O Musa!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Cast it down, O Moses!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Moses, throw it down.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Moses, cast it down'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Lord said, "Moses, throw it on the ground".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Cast it down, O Musa!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God said, "Moses, cast it down."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Allah) said, "Throw it, O Moses!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He answered: "Granted is your prayer, O Moses.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said He, 'Thou art granted, Moses, thy petition.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: surely thou art granted thy petition, O Musa!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Allah said: "You are granted your request, O Musa (Moses)!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “You are granted your request, O Moses.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Moses, your petition is granted.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Allah) said: "You are granted your request, O Musa!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Thou art granted thy request, O Moses.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Moses, your request has been granted!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He replied: 'Moses, your request is granted.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Lord said, "Moses, your request is granted.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: You are indeed granted your petition, O Musa

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God said, "You have been granted your request, Moses."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Allah) said: "Granted is thy prayer, O Moses!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He asked: "Who then is that Lord of yours, O Moses?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'Who is your Lord, Moses?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: who is the Lord of you twain, O Musa!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Who then, O Musa (Moses), is the Lord of you two?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Who is your Lord, O Moses.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said:" Moses! Who is the Lord of the two of you?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Fir`awn said: "Who then, O Musa, is the Lord of you two"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Who is your Lord, Moses?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) said: 'Moses, who is the Lord of you both'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked them, "Who is your Lord?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (Firon) said: And who is your Lord, O Musa?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Who then is the Lord of you both, Moses?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (When this message was delivered), (Pharaoh) said: "Who, then, O Moses, is the Lord of you two?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said to them: "Woe betide you. Do not fabricate a lie against God, or He will destroy you with some affliction. For he who fabricates lies is doomed to failure."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and Moses said to them, 'O beware! Forge not a lie against God, lest He destroy you with a chastisement. Whoso forges has ever failed.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said unto them: woe unto you! fabricate not against Allah a lie, lest he extirpate you with a torment, and surely He who fabricateth, loseth.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said to them: "Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you completely by a torment. And surely, he who invents a lie (against Allah) will fail miserably."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said to them, “Woe to you. Do not fabricate lies against God, or He will destroy you with a punishment. He who invents lies will fail.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (At the time of the encounter) Moses said to them: "Woe to you! Do not invent falsehoods against Allah lest He destroy you with a scourge. Surely those who invent lies shall come to grief."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said to them: "Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you completely by a torment. And surely, he who invents a lie (against Allah) will fail miserably."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He extirpate you by some punishment. He who lieth faileth miserably.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said to them, ‘Woe to you! Do not fabricate lies against Allah, or He will obliterate you with a punishment. Whoever fabricates lies certainly fails.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and Moses said to them: 'Alas! Do not forge a lie against Allah lest He destroys you with a punishment. Indeed, whosoever forges has failed'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses told them, (the magicians) "Woe to you if you invent falsehood against God; you will be destroyed by the torment. Whoever invents falsehood against God will certainly be lost."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Musa said to them: Woe to you! do not forge a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you by a punishment, and he who forges (a lie) indeed fails to attain (his desire).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said to them, "Woe to you! Do not invent lies against God, lest He destroy you by some calamity: whoever invents lies is bound to fail."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said to him: Woe to you! Forge not ye a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger must suffer frustration!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And Moses felt afraid within himself.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and Moses conceived a fear within him.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then a kind of fear in his soul Musa felt.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So Musa (Moses) conceived a fear in himself.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So Moses felt apprehensive within himself.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So Moses' heart was filled with fear.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So Musa conceived fear in himself.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Moses conceived a fear in his mind.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Moses felt a fear within his heart.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses became fearful within himself.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses felt afraid within himself.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So Musa conceived in his mind a fear.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and in his heart Moses became apprehensive,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The magicians, (seeing the miracle), fell down in prostration, saying: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And the sorcerers cast themselves down prostrating. 'We believe,' they said, 'in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then the magicians were cast down prostrate; they said: we believe in the Lord of Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Harun (Aaron) and Musa (Moses)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And the magicians fell down prostrate. They said, “We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Eventually the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate and said: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Harun and Musa."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat the magicians fell down prostrating. They said, ‘We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Thereafter the sorcerers threw themselves down, prostrating, saying: 'We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The magicians bowed down in prostration saying, "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the magicians were cast down making obeisance; they said: We believe in the Lord of Haroun and Musa.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The magicians then prostrated themselves. They said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We commanded Moses: "Journey by night with Our creatures, and strike a dry path for them through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, nor have dread of any thing."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Also We revealed unto Moses, 'Go with My servants by night; strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not overtaking, neither afraid.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We revealed unto Musa, saying: depart in night with my bondmen, and make for them in the sea a parth dry: thou Shalt fear neither overtaking, nor shalt thou be afraid.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Travel by night with Ibadi (My slaves) and strike a dry path for them in the sea, fearing neither to be overtaken [by Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] nor being afraid (of drowning in the sea)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We inspired Moses: “Travel by night with My servants, and strike for them a dry path across the sea, not fearing being overtaken, nor worrying.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Most certainly We revealed to Moses: "Proceed with My servants in the night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be afraid of treading through the sea."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We revealed to Musa: "Travel by night with My servants and strike a dry path for them in the sea, fearing neither to be overtaken nor being afraid."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to be overtaken, neither being afraid (of the sea).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We revealed to Moses, [saying], ‘Set out with My servants at night, and strike out for them a dry path through the sea. Do not be afraid of being overtaken, and have no fear [of getting drowned].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: To Moses we also revealed: 'Set forth with My worshipers by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Do not fear that you will be overtaken, neither be afraid'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent revelations to Moses telling him, "Travel with My servants during the night and strike a dry road across the sea (for them). Have no fear of being overtaken (by the Pharaoh) nor of anything else".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We revealed to Musa, saying: Travel by night with My servants, then make for them a dry path in the sea, not fearing to be overtaken, nor being afraid.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent a revelation to Moses saying, "Take away My servants by night and strike for them a dry path through the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken and do not be afraid."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with My servants, and strike a dry path for them through the sea, without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: What made you hurry away, O Moses, from your people?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'What has sped thee far from thy people, Moses?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And what hath made thee hasten from thy people, O Musa?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And what made you hasten from your people, O Musa (Moses)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “And what made you rush ahead of your people, O Moses?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: "But, O Moses, what has made you come in haste from your people?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And what made you hasten from your people, O Musa

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (it was said): What hath made thee hasten from thy folk, O Moses?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [God said,] ‘O Moses, what has prompted you to hasten ahead of your people?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Moses, why have you come with such haste from your nation'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Allah] said, "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Lord asked, "Moses, what made you attend your appointment with Me before your people?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And what caused you to hasten from your people, O Musa?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [When Moses was upon the Mount, God said,] "O Moses, why have you come with such haste from your people?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So Moses returned to his people full of anger and regret. "O my people," he said, "did not your Lord make you a better promise? Did the time of covenant seem too long to you? Or did you wish the wrath of your Lord to fall upon you that you broke the promise you had made to me?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then Moses returned very angry and sorrowful to his people, saying, 'My people, did your Lord not promise a fair promise to you? Did the time of the covenant seem so long to you, or did you desire that anger should alight on you from your Lord, so that you failed in your tryst with me?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: So Musa returned unto his people, indignant and sorrowful. He said: O my people! promised there not your Lord unto you an excellent promise! Lasted then the covenant too long for you, or desired ye that the wrath from your Lord should alight on you, so that ye failed to keep my appointment?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then Musa (Moses) returned to his people in a state of anger and sorrow. He said: "O my people! Did not your Lord promise you a fair promise? Did then the promise seem to you long in coming? Or did you desire that wrath should descend from your Lord on you, so you broke your promise to me (i.e. disbelieving in Allah and worshipping the calf)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So Moses returned to his people, angry and disappointed. He said, “O my people, did your Lord not promise you a good promise? Was the time too long for you? Or did you want wrath from your Lord to descend upon you, so you broke your promise to me?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses returned to his people full of wrath and grief, and said: "My people! Has your Lord not made good an excellent promise He made to you? And has a long time passed since those promises were fulfilled? Or was it to incur the wrath of your Lord that you broke your promise with me?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then Musa returned to his people in a state of anger and sorrow [Asif]. He said: "O my people! Did not your Lord promise you a fair promise Did then the promise seem to you long in coming Or did you desire that wrath should descend from your Lord on you, that you broke your promise to me"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then Moses went back unto his folk, angry and sad. He said: O my people! Hath not your Lord promised you a fair promise? Did the time appointed then appear too long for you, or did ye wish that wrath from your Lord should come upon you, that ye broke tryst with me?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereupon Moses returned to his people, indignant and grieved. He said, ‘O my people! Did your Lord not give you a true promise? Did the period [of my absence] seem too long to you? Or did you desire that your Lord’s wrath should descend on you and so you failed your tryst with me?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: With great anger and sorrow, Moses returned to his nation. 'My nation' he said, 'did your Lord not make you a fine promise? Did the time of the covenant seem long to you? Or did you desire that the anger of your Lord should fall upon you so that you failed in your coming to my appointment'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses, sad and angry, returned to his people saying, "My people, did not the Lord make you a gracious promise? Why did you disregard your appointment with me? Was it because of the long time or did you want to become subject to the wrath of your Lord?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So Musa returned to his people wrathful, sorrowing. Said he: O my people! did not your Lord promise you a goodly promise: did then the time seem long to you, or did you wish that displeasure from your Lord should be due to you, so that you broke (your) promise to me?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses returned to his people in anger and great sorrow. He said, "My people, did your Lord not make you a handsome promise? Was my absence too long for you? Did you desire that your Lord's wrath should descend upon you, when you broke your promise to me?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So Moses returned to his people in a state of indignation and sorrow. He said: "O my people! did not your Lord make a handsome promise to you? Did then the promise seem to you long (in coming)? Or did ye desire that Wrath should descend from your Lord on you, and so ye broke your promise to me?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he produced the image of a calf which mooed like a cow. And they said: 'This is your god and the god of Moses (whom) he has neglected."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: (Then he brought out for them a Calf, a mere body that lowed; and they said, 'This is your god, and the god of Moses, whom he has forgotten.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he produced for them a calf: a body with a low. Then they Said: this is your god and the god of Musa, and that he forgat.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then he took out (of the fire) for them a statue of a calf which seemed to low. They said: "This is your ilah (god), and the ilah (god) of Musa (Moses), but [Musa (Moses)] has forgotten (his god).'"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So he produced for them a calf—a mere body which lowed. And they said, “This is your god, and the god of Moses, but he has forgotten.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and brought out of there (from the molten gold) the effigy of a calf that lowed." The people cried out: "This is your deity and the deity of Moses, whom Moses has forgotten."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he took out for them a calf which was mooing. They said: "This is your god, and the god of Musa," but he had forgotten.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he produced for them a calf, of saffron hue, which gave forth a lowing sound. And they cried: This is your god and the god of Moses, but he hath forgotten.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he produced for them a calf—a [lifeless] body with a low—and they said, This is your god and the god of Moses, so he forgot!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and made a calf for them, a figure that lowed. "This," they said, "is your god and the god of Moses but whom he has forgotten."

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then the Samiri forged the body of a motionless calf which gave out a hollow sound." The people said, "This is your Lord and the Lord of Moses whom he (Moses) forgot to mention".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he brought forth for them a calf, a (mere) body, which had a mooing sound, so they said: This is your god and the god of Musa, but he forgot.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then he forged a calf for them -- an image producing a lowing sound. They said, "This is your deity, the deity of Moses; he has forgotten it."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Has the story of Moses come to you?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Hast thou received the story of Moses?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Hath there come unto thee the story of Musa?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And has there come to you the story of Musa (Moses)?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Has the story of Moses reached you?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Has the story of Moses reached you?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And has there come to you the story of Musa

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Hath there come unto thee the story of Moses?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Did the story of Moses come to you,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Has the story of Moses reached you?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), have you heard the story of Moses?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And has the story of Musa come to you?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Have you heard the story of Moses?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Has the story of Moses reached thee?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said "So long as Moses does not come back we are not going to give it up, and we will remain devoted to it."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'We will not cease,' they said, 'to cleave to it, until Moses returns to us.')

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: we shall by no means cease to be assiduous to it until there returneth to us Musa.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "We will not stop worshipping it (i.e. the calf), until Musa (Moses) returns to us."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We will not give up our devotion to it, until Moses returns to us.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But they answered: "By no means shall we cease to worship it until Moses returns to us."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We will not stop worshipping it, until Musa returns to us."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We shall by no means cease to be its votaries till Moses return unto us.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They had said, ‘We will keep on clinging to it until Moses returns to us.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They replied: 'We will not stop; we will cling to it until Moses returns to us.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to the calf until Moses returns to us."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "We shall continue worshipping the calf until Moses comes back."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We will by no means cease to keep to its worship until Musa returns to us.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They replied, "We shall not cease to worship it until Moses returns to us."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They had said: "We will not abandon this cult, but we will devote ourselves to it until Moses returns to us."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and a light and reminder for those who take heed for themselves,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Salvation and a Radiance, and a Remembrance for the godfearing

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vcuchsafed unto Musa and Harun the distinction and illumination and an admonition for the God-fearing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We granted to Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron) the criterion (of right and wrong), and a shining light [i.e. the Taurat (Torah)] and a Reminder for Al-Muttaqun (the pious - see V. 2:2).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and illumination, and a reminder for the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We had granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (between right and wrong), and Light and Admonition for the good of the God-fearing,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We granted to Musa and Harun the criterion, and a shining light and a Reminder for those who have Taqwa.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) and a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, a light and reminder for the Godwary

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and gave them a light and a Remembrance for the cautious:

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Moses and Aaron We granted the criteria of discerning right from wrong, and We gave them the light and a reminder to the pious ones

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave to Musa and Haroun the Furqan and a light and a reminder for those who would guard (against evil).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the criterion of right and wrong and a light and reminder for the righteous,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And the people of Midian too. Moses was also accused of lies. So I allowed the infidels respite and then seized them. How was My reprobation then!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and the men of Midian; to Moses also they cried lies. And I respited the unbelievers, then I seized them; and how was My horror!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the denizens of Madyan. And belied was Musa. I gave rein to the infidels; then took hold of them; so how hath been My wrath!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And the dwellers of Madyan (Midian); and belied was Musa (Moses), but I granted respite to the disbelievers for a while, then I seized them, and how (terrible) was My Punishment (against their wrong-doing).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And the inhabitants of Median. And Moses was denied. Then I reprieved those who disbelieved, but then I seized them. So how was My rejection?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them. How dreadful was My punishment!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And the dwellers of Madyan; and denied was Musa. But I granted respite to the disbelievers for a while, then I seized them, and how (terrible) was My punishment!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (And) the dwellers in Midian. And Moses was denied; but I indulged the disbelievers a long while, then I seized them, and how (terrible) was My abhorrence!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and the inhabitants of Midian, and Moses was also impugned. But I gave the faithless a respite, then I seized them and how was My rebuttal!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and the inhabitants of Midian, to Moses they also belied. I respited the unbelievers, then I seized them, and how was My disapproval!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Midian, and Moses had also called their Prophets liars. I gave respite to the unbelievers, then sized them with torment. How terrible was that torment!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: As well as those of Madyan and Musa (too) was rejected, but I gave respite to the unbelievers, then did I overtake them, so how (severe) was My disapproval.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and the inhabitants of Midian also charged their prophets with falsehood. Moses was also rejected. I gave respite to those who denied the truth, but then I seized them. Consider then, how terrible My repudiation of them was.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And the Companions of the Madyan People; and Moses was rejected (in the same way). But I granted respite to the Unbelievers, and (only) after that did I punish them: but how (terrible) was my rejection (of them)!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear proofs

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Thereafter We sent Musa and his brother Harun with Our signs and an authority manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We sent Musa (Moses) and his brother Harun (Aaron), with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and manifest authority,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our signs and a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We sent Musa and his brother Harun, with Our Ayat and manifest authority,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a clear warrant

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and Aaron, his brother, with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear authority

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then We sent Musa and his brother Haroun, with Our communications and a clear authority,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We gave the Book to Moses so that they may be guided.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, that haply they would be guided;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed unto Musa the Book, that haply they may be guided.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture, that they may be guided.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Scripture, that they may be guided.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book that people might be guided by it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa the Scripture, that they may be guided.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go aright.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, in order that they might be guided.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses so that perhaps they may have guidance.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave Musa the Book that they may follow a right direction.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, in order that they might receive guidance.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and made his brother Aaron his minister,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and appointed with him his brother Aaron as minister

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed unto Musa the Book and We placed with him his brother Harun as a minister.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture [the Taurat (Torah)], and placed his brother Harun (Aaron) with him as a helper;

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Scripture, and appointed his brother Aaron as his assistant.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his counsellor:

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa the Scripture, and placed his brother Harun with him as a helper;

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his brother Aaron as henchman.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book and We made Aaron, his brother, accompany him as a minister.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses and gave him his brother Aaron as a minister.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses and made his brother Aaron his Minister.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave Musa the Book and We appointed with him his brother Haroun an aider.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and appointed his brother Aaron as his supporter.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,

translation.author: Arberry

translation.author: Mubarakpuri

translation.author: Pickthall

translation.author: Saheeh International

translation.author: Sarwar

translation.author: Shakir

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said to them: "Throw ye - that which ye are about to throw!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then Moses cast his staff and lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then Musa cast down his staff, and lo! it swallowed up that which they had devised.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then Musa (Moses) threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all the falsehoods which they showed!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then Moses threw his staff, and behold, it began swallowing their trickery.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then Musa threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all that they falsely showed!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat Moses threw down his staff, and behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then Moses cast down his staff and it swallowed up their lying invention,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then Moses cast down his staff and suddenly it swallowed up what they had falsely invented.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then Musa cast down his staff and lo! it swallowed up the lies they told.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then Moses threw down his staff, and it swallowed up all that they had conjured into being.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then Moses threw his rod, when, behold, it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and, when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, 'We are overtaken!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when the two parties saw each other, the companions of Musa said: verily we are overtaken.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa (Moses) said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When the two groups sighted each other, the followers of Moses said, “We are being overtaken.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, ‘Indeed we have been caught up.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the two hosts came in view of each other, Moses' companions said: 'We have been reached'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of the Pharaoh pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa cried out: Most surely we are being overtaken.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and when the two groups saw each other, Moses' companions said, "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses, 'Strike with thy staff the sea'; and it clave, and each part was as a mighty mount.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We revealed unto Musa, saying: smite thou the sea with thy staff. So it became separated, and each part was like unto a cliff mighty.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part (of that sea water) became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff.” Whereupon it parted, and each part was like a huge hill.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We revealed to Musa (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part became like huge mountain.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff!’ Whereupon it parted, and each part was as if it were a great mountain.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses: 'Strike the sea with your staff', so it divided and each part was as a mighty mount.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "Certainly not. My Lord is with me and He will certainly guide me."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then We revealed to Musa: Strike the sea with your staff. So it had cloven asunder, and each part was like a huge mound.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We bade Moses strike the sea with his staff. And it parted, and each part was like a huge mountain.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod." So it divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses," (said the voice), "be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Cast down thy staff.' And when he saw it quivering like a serpent he turned about, retreating, and turned not back. 'Moses, fear not; surely the Envoys do not fear in My presence,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And cast thou down thy staff. Then when he saw it wriggling as though it were a serpent, he turned in flight and looked not back. O Musa! fear thou not; verily in My presence the sent ones fear not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And throw down your stick!" But when he saw it moving as if it were a snake, he turned in flight, and did not look back. (It was said): "O Musa (Moses)! Fear not, verily! The Messengers fear not in front of Me.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Throw down your staff.” But when he saw it quivering, as though it were a demon, he turned around not looking back. “O Moses, do not fear; the messengers do not fear in My presence.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Now cast your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent, he turned his back in retreat and did not even look behind. "O Moses, have no fear. Messengers have no fear in My presence,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And throw down your stick!" But when he saw it moving as if it were a snake, he turned in flight, and did not look back. (It was said:) "O Musa! Fear not: verily, the Messengers fear not in front of Me."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And throw down thy staff! But when he saw it writhing as it were a demon, he turned to flee headlong; (but it was said unto him): O Moses! Fear not! the emissaries fear not in My presence,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Throw down your staff!’ When he saw it wriggling, as if it were a snake, he turned his back [to flee], without looking back. ‘O Moses! ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed the apostles are not afraid before Me,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Cast down your staff' And when he saw it writhing like a serpent, he turned about retreating, and did not turn back. 'Moses, do not fear, indeed theMessengers do not fear (when they are) with Me,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Throw down your staff." When Moses saw his staff on the ground moving like a living creature, he stepped back and did not come forward again. The Lord said,"Moses, do not be afraid. Messengers do not become afraid in My presence".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And cast down your staff. So when he saw it in motion as if it were a serpent, he turned back retreating and did not return: O Musa! fear not; surely the apostles shall not fear in My presence;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Throw down your staff." But when he saw it moving like a snake, he turned and fled. "Moses, do not be afraid! The messengers need have no fear in My presence;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake, he turned back in retreat, and retraced not his steps: "O Moses!" (it was said), "Fear not: truly, in My presence, those called as messengers have no fear,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it, or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When Moses said to his people 'I observe a fire, and will bring you news of it, or I will bring you a flaming brand, that haply you shall warm yourselves.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time Musa said unto his household: verily I perceive a fire afar; I shall forthwith bring you tidings thereof, or bring unto you a brand lighted therefrom, haply ye may warm yourselves.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (Remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his household: "Verily! I have seen a fire, I will bring you from there some information, or I will bring you a burning brand, that you may warm yourselves."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Moses said to his family, “I have glimpsed a fire. I will bring you some news from it; or bring you a firebrand, that you may warm yourselves.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (Recount to them) when Moses said to his family: "I perceive something like fire: soon will I bring to you some information from there, or I will bring you a burning brand that you may warm yourselves."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Remember) when Musa said to his household: "Verily, I have seen a fire; I will bring you from there some information, or I will bring you a burning ember, that you may warm yourselves."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Remember) when Moses said unto his household: Lo! I spy afar off a fire; I will bring you tidings thence, or bring to you a borrowed flame that ye may warm yourselves.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Moses said to his family, ‘Indeed I descry a fire! I will bring you some news from it, or bring you a firebrand so that you may warm yourselves.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When Moses said to his household: 'Indeed, I can see a fire far away. I will go and bring you news of it or I will bring you a lighted flame so that you can warm yourselves'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said to his family, "I have seen some fire. I shall bring you some news about it or some fire so that you can warmyourselves".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When Musa said to his family: Surely I see fire; I will bring to you from it some news, or I will bring to you therefrom a burning firebrand so that you may warm yourselves.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell of Moses who said to his family, "I have seen a fire. I will bring you news from there, or a burning brand for you to warm yourselves."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! Moses said to his family: "I perceive a fire; soon will I bring you from there some information, or I will bring you a burning brand to light our fuel, that ye may warm yourselves.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O Moses, I am that God, the mighty and all-wise.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Moses, behold, it is I, God, the All-mighty, the All-wise.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Musa! verily it is I, Allah, the Mighty the Wise!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O Musa (Moses)! Verily! It is I, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O Moses, it is I, God, the Almighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: O Moses, verily this is Me, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O Musa! Verily, it is I, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O Moses! Lo! it is I, Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘O Moses! Indeed I am Allah, the All-mighty, the All-wise.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses, it is I, Allah, the Almighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses, I am God, the Majestic and All-wise.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O Musa! surely I am Allah, the Mighty, the Wise;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: O Moses, I am God, the Powerful, the Wise.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O Moses! verily, I am Allah, the exalted in might, the wise!....

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He came to the city when the people were in a care-free mood, and saw two men quarrelling, one belonging to his community, the other to his enemies. The man who belonged to his community appealed for help against the one who belonged to the enemies. Moses struck him a blow with his fist and finished him off. "This is of Satan's doing," he said. "He is certainly an enemy and a corrupter."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And he entered the city, at a time when its people were unheeding, and found there two men fighting; the one was of his own party, and the other was of his enemies. Then the one that was of his party cried to him to aid him against the other that was of his enemies; so Moses struck him, and despatched him, and said, 'This is of Satan's doing; he is surely an enemy misleading, manifest.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he entered the City at a time of unawareness of the inhabitants thereof, and he found therein two men fighting, one being of his own party, and the other of his enemies. And he who was of his party, called him for help against him who was of his enemies. So Musa truck him with his fist, and put an end of him. He said: this is of the work of the satan, verily he is an enemy, a misleader manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And he entered the city at a time of unawareness of its people, and he found there two men fighting, - one of his party (his religion - from the Children of Israel), and the other of his foes. The man of his (own) party asked him for help against his foe, so Musa (Moses) struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: "This is of Shaitan's (Satan) doing, verily, he is a plain misleading enemy."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Once he entered the city, unnoticed by its people. He found in it two men fighting—one of his own sect, and one from his enemies. The one of his sect solicited his assistance against the one from his enemies; so Moses punched him, and put an end to him. He said, “This is of Satan's doing; he is an enemy that openly misleads.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Once he entered the city at a time when its people were heedless, and he encountered two men fighting, one of whom belonged to his own people and the other to his foes. Now the man belonging to Moses' own people cried out to him for help against the man from the foes, and Moses struck him with his fist and finished him. Moses said: "This is an act of Satan. Surely he is an enemy who openly misleads."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And he entered the city when its people were unaware: and he found there two men fighting, -- one of his party, and the other of his foes. The man of his (own) party asked him for help against his foe, so Musa struck him with his fist and he died. He said: "This is of Shaytan's doing, verily, he is a plain misleading enemy."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And he entered the city at a time of carelessness of its folk, and he found therein two men fighting, one of his own caste, and the other of his enemies; and he who was of his caste asked him for help against him who was of his enemies. So Moses struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: This is of the devil's doing. Lo! he is an enemy, a mere misleader.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [One day] he entered the city at a time when its people were not likely to take notice. He found there two men fighting, this one from among his followers, and that one from his enemies. The one who was from his followers sought his help against him who was from his enemies. So Moses hit him with his fist, whereupon he expired. He said, ‘This is of Satan’s doing. Indeed he is clearly a misguiding enemy.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And he entered the city unnoticed by the people and found two men fighting, one was of his own party, and the other of his enemies. The one of his party appealed for his help against his enemy, Moses struck and killed him, and said: 'This is the work of satan, he is surely a clear, misleading enemy.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He entered the city without the knowledge of its inhabitants and found two men fighting each other. One was his follower and the other his enemy. His follower asked him for help. Moses struck his enemy to death, but later said, "It was the work of satan; he is the sworn enemy of the human being and wants to mislead him".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And he went into the city at a time of unvigilance on the part of its people, so he found therein two men fighting, one being of his party and the other of his foes, and he who was of his party cried out to him for help against him who was of his enemies, so Musa struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: This is on account of the Shaitan's doing; surely he is an enemy, openly leading astray.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He entered the city unnoticed by its people, and there he encountered two men fighting with one another -- one of his own people and the other one of his enemies. The one who belonged to his own people cried out to him for help against his foe -- whereupon Moses struck him down with his fist, thereby causing his death. Moses said, "This is Satan's doing; he is an open foe, leading man astray."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And he entered the city at a time when its people were not watching: and he found there two men fighting,- one of his own religion, and the other, of his foes. Now the man of his own religion appealed to him against his foe, and Moses struck him with his fist and made an end of him. He said: "This is a work of Evil (Satan): for he is an enemy that manifestly misleads!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: In the morning he came to the city, fearful and hesitant. Just then he who had asked him for help the day before called out for help (again). "You are indeed a meddlesome fellow," Moses said to him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Now in the morning he was in the city, fearful and vigilant; and behold, the man who had sought his, succour on the day before cried out to him again. Moses said to him, 'Clearly thou art, a quarreller.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And in the morning he was in the city fearing and looking about, when lo! he who had asked his succour yesterday was crying out unto him. Musa said: verily thou art a seducer manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So he became afraid, looking about in the city (waiting as to what will be the result of his crime of killing), when behold, the man who had sought his help the day before, called for his help (again). Musa (Moses) said to him: "Verily, you are a plain misleader!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The next morning, he went about in the city, fearful and vigilant, when the man who had sought his assistance the day before was shouting out to him. Moses said to him, “You are clearly a troublemaker.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The next morning he proceeded to the city in fear and looking around as one apprehensive of danger when all of a sudden, the man who had sought his help the day before again called out to him for his help. Moses said to him: "Clearly, you are a very misguided fellow."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So he became afraid, looking about in the city, when behold, the man who had sought his help the day before, called for his help (again). Musa said to him: "Verily, you are a plain misleader!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And morning found him in the city, fearing, vigilant, when behold! he who had appealed to him the day before cried out to him for help. Moses said unto him: Lo! thou art indeed a mere hothead.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He rose at dawn in the city, fearful and vigilant, when behold, the one who had sought his help the day before, shouted for his help [once again]. Moses said to him, ‘You are indeed clearly perverse!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: In the morning, he was in the city, fearful and vigilant, then he whom he had helped the day before cried out to him again for help. 'Clearly' said Moses, 'you are quarrelsome'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure], when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He remained in the city but very afraid and cautious. Suddenly the person who asked him for help the previous day asked him for help again. Moses said, "You are certainly a mischievous person".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And he was in the city, fearing, awaiting, when lo! he who had asked his assistance the day before was crying out to him for aid. Musa said to him: You are most surely one erring manifestly.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The next morning, when he was walking in the city, apprehensive, and watchful, and the man who had sought his help the day before cried out to him again for help. Moses said to him, "You are clearly a misguided man."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So he saw the morning in the city, looking about, in a state of fear, when behold, the man who had, the day before, sought his help called aloud for his help (again). Moses said to him: "Thou art truly, it is clear, a quarrelsome fellow!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then as he was about to lay hands on the one who was their common enemy, he cried out: "O Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed that person yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: But when he would have assaulted the man who was an enemy to them both, the man said, 'Moses, dost thou' desire to slay me, even as thou slewest a living 'soul yesterday? Thou only desirest to be a tyrant in the land; thou desirest not to be of them that put things right.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when he sought to seize him who was an enemy unto them both, he said: O Musa wouldst thou slay me as thou didst slay a person yesterday? Thou seekest only to be a tyrant in the land, and thou seekest not to be of the reconcilers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when he decided to seize the man who was an enemy to both of them, the man said: "O Musa (Moses)! Is it your intention to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? Your aim is nothing but to become a tyrant in the land, and not to be one of those who do right."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: As he was about to strike the one who was their enemy, he said, “O Moses, do you intend to kill me, as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a bully in the land, and do not want to be a peacemaker.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And when Moses decided to lay his violent hands on the man belonging to the enemy, he cried out: "Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed a person yesterday?" You simply want to live in the land as a tyrant, and do not wish to set things right."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when he decided to seize the man who was an enemy to both of them, the man said: "O Musa! Is it your intention to kill me as you killed a man yesterday Your aim is nothing but to become a tyrant in the land, and not to be one of those who do right."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when he would have fallen upon the man who was an enemy unto them both, he said: O Moses! Wouldst thou kill me as thou didst kill a person yesterday. Thou wouldst be nothing but a tyrant in the land, thou wouldst not be of the reformers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But when he wanted to strike him who was an enemy of both of them, he said, ‘Moses, do you want to kill me, just like the one you killed yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land, and you do not desire to be one who brings about reform.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Moses was about to seize he who was the enemy of both of them, he said: 'Moses, would you kill me as you killed a living soul yesterday? You desire only to be a tyrant in the land, and you do not want to be among the reformers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Moses was about to attack their enemy, he said, "Moses, do you want to kill me as you slew a soul the other day? Do you want to become a tyrant in the land, not a reformer?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when he desired to seize him who was an enemy to them both, he said: O Musa! do you intend to kill me as you killed a person yesterday? You desire nothing but that you should be a tyrant in the land, and you do not desire to be of those who act aright.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When he wanted to catch the one who was an enemy to them both, the man said, "Moses, do you want to kill me just as you killed a man yesterday? You only want to become a tyrant in the land; you do not want to set things right."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then, when he decided to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to both of them, that man said: "O Moses! Is it thy intention to slay me as thou slewest a man yesterday? Thy intention is none other than to become a powerful violent man in the land, and not to be one who sets things right!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: There came a man running from the other part of the city. "O Moses," he said, "the chiefs are deliberating to kill you. Go away from the city. I wish you well."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then came a man from the furthest part of the city, running; he said, 'Moses, the Council are conspiring to slay thee. Depart; I am one of thy sincere advisers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And there came a man from the farthest part of the city, running; he said: O Musa! the chiefs are taking counsel together concerning thee, that they might slay thee; wherefore go forth thou, verily I am unto thee of the admonishers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And there came a man running, from the farthest end of the city. He said: "O Musa (Moses)! Verily, the chiefs are taking counsel together about you, to kill you, so escape. Truly, I am to you of those who give sincere advice."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And a man came from the farthest part of the city running. He said, “O Moses, the authorities are considering killing you, so leave; I am giving you good advice.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then a man came running from the farther end of the city and said: "O Moses, the nobles are deliberating about you that they may put you to death. So do be gone. I am one of your well-wishers."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And there came a man running, from the farthest end of the city. He said: "O Musa! Verily, the chiefs are taking counsel together about you, to kill you, so escape. Truly, I am one of the good advisers to you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And a man came from the uttermost part of the city, running. He said: O Moses! Lo! the chiefs take counsel against thee to slay thee; therefor escape. Lo! I am of those who give thee good advice.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: There came a man from the city outskirts, hurrying. He said, ‘Moses! The elite are indeed conspiring to kill you. So leave. I am indeed your well-wisher.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then a man came running from the furthest part of the city, 'Moses' he said, 'the Assembly are plotting to kill you. Leave, for I am one of your sincere advisers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: A man came running from the farthest part of the city saying, "Moses, people are planning to kill you. I sincerely advise you to leave the city.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And a man came running from the remotest part of the city. He said: O Musa! surely the chiefs are consulting together to slay you, therefore depart (at once); surely I am of those who wish well to you.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: A man came running from the far side of the city, and said, "Moses, the authorities are conspiring to kill you, so leave the city. I am one of your well-wishers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And there came a man, running, from the furthest end of the City. He said: "O Moses! the Chiefs are taking counsel together about thee, to slay thee: so get thee away, for I do give thee sincere advice."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Moses had fulfilled the term and was journeying with his family, he noticed a fire on the side of the mountain. "Wait here," he said to his family; "I have seen a fire. I may haply bring some news from there, or an ember that you may warm yourselves."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So when Moses had accomplished the term and departed with his household, he observed on the side of the Mount a fire. He said to his household, 'Tarry you here; I observe a fire.
