translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Scripture, so [Muhammad] do not doubt that you are receiving it, just as We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did indeed aforetime give the Book to Moses: be not then in doubt of its reaching (thee): and We made it a guide to the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O you who believe, do not be like those who maligned Moses, whilst God cleared him of what they alleged; and he was held in high esteem with God.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: O believers, be not as those who hurt Moses, but God declared him quit of what they said, and he was high honoured with God.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Ye who believe! be not like unto those who annoyed Musa; but Allah cleared him of that which they said, and he was in the sight of Allah illustrious.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O you who believe! Be not like those who annoyed Musa (Moses), but Allah cleared him of that which they alleged, and he was honourable before Allah.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O you who believe! Do not be like those who abused Moses; but God cleared him of what they said. He was distinguished with God.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Believers, do not be like those who distressed Moses and then Allah declared him quit of the ill they spoke about him; and he had a high standing with Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O you who believe! Be not like those who annoyed Musa, but Allah cleared him of that which they alleged, and he was honorable before Allah.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O ye who believe! Be not as those who slandered Moses, but Allah proved his innocence of that which they alleged, and he was well esteemed in Allah's sight.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O you who have faith! Do not be like those who offended Moses, whereat Allah cleared him of what they alleged, and he was distinguished in Allah’s sight.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Believers, do not be like those who hurt Moses. Allah cleared him of what they said. His face is honorable with Allah.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then Allah cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allah, was distinguished.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Believers, do not be like those who annoyed Moses. God proved him to be innocent of what they had said about him. Moses was a honorable person in the sight of God.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O you who believe! be not like those who spoke evil things of Musa, but Allah cleared him of what they said, and he was worthy of regard with Allah.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Believers, do not behave like those who slandered Moses. God cleared him of their allegations. He was honourable in the sight of God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye who believe! Be ye not like those who vexed and insulted Moses, but Allah cleared him of the (calumnies) they had uttered: and he was honourable in Allah's sight.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We made the covenant with the prophets, and with you, as with Noah and Abraham, Moses and Jesus son of Mary, a binding covenant,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We took compact from the Prophets, and from thee, and from Noah, and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, Mary's son; We took from them a solemn compact,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We took a bond from the prophets and from thee and from Nuh and Ibrahim and Musa and 'Isa son of Maryam. And We took from them a solemn bond;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We took from the Prophets their covenant, and from you (O Muhammad SAW), and from Nuh (Noah), Ibrahim (Abraham), Musa (Moses), and 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary). We took from them a strong covenant.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Recall that We received a pledge from the prophets, and from you, and from Noah, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus son of Mary. We received from them a solemn pledge.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And call to mind, (O Prophet), when We took the covenant from all Prophets; and also from you and Noah and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when We took from the Prophets their covenant, and from you, and from Nuh, Ibrahim, Musa, and `Isa son of Maryam. We took from them a strong covenant.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We exacted a covenant from the prophets, and from thee (O Muhammad) and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [Recall] when We took a pledge from the prophets, and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus son of Mary, and We took from them a solemn pledge,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We took from the Prophets their covenant and from you (Prophet Muhammad), from Noah and Abraham, from Moses and Jesus the son of Mary. We took a solemn covenant from them,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a solemn covenant.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had a solemn covenant with you (Muhammad), and the Prophets: Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, the son of Mary.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We made a covenant with the prophets and with you, and with Nuh and Ibrahim and Musa and Isa, son of Marium, and We made with them a strong covenant

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We took a solemn pledge from the prophets, from you and Noah, Abraham, Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary -- We took a solemn pledge from all of them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember We took from the prophets their covenant: As (We did) from thee: from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary: We took from them a solemn covenant:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We were indeed gracious to Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also favoured Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We gave grace Unto Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Our Grace to Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We blessed Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Verily We bestowed Our favours on Moses and Aaron

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Our grace to Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave grace unto Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We favoured Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We also favored Moses and Aaron

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We certainly bestowed Our favor upon Moses and Aaron

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We conferred a favor on Musa and Haroun.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We also bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Again (of old) We bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Peace be on Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Peace be upon Moses and, Aaron!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Peace be Unto Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Salamun (peace) be upon Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Salam (peace!) be upon Musa and Harun!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Peace be unto Moses and Aaron!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Peace be to Moses and Aaron!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Peace be upon Moses and Aaron'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Peace be with Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Peace be on Musa and Haroun.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Peace be upon Moses and Aaron!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Peace and salutation to Moses and Aaron!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Say: "We believe in God, and in what has been revealed to us, and in what had been sent down to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and their offspring, and what had been revealed to Moses and to Jesus and to all other prophets by their Lord. We make no distinction between them, and we submit to Him and obey."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Say: 'We believe in God, and that which has been sent down on us, and sent down on Abraham and Ishmael, Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes, and in that which was given to Moses and Jesus, and the Prophets, of their Lord; we make no division between any of them, and to Him we surrender.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Say thou: we believe in Allah and in that which is sent down unto us, and that which was sent down unto Ibrahim and Isma'il and Is-haq and Ya'qub and the tribes, and that which was vouchsafed unto Musa and 'Isa and other prophets from their Lord: we differentiate not between any of them, and unto Him we are submistive.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "We believe in Allah and in what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down to Ibrahim (Abraham), Isma'il (Ishmael), Ishaque (Isaac), Ya'qub (Jacob) and Al-Asbat [the twelve sons of Ya'qub (Jacob)] and what was given to Musa (Moses), 'Iesa (Jesus) and the Prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between one another among them and to Him (Allah) we have submitted (in Islam)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “We believe in God, and in what was revealed to us; and in what was revealed to Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the Patriarchs; and in what was given to Moses, and Jesus, and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and to Him we submit.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Say: 'We believe in Allah and what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and to Issac and Jacob and his descendents, and the teachings which Allah gave to Moses and Jesus and to other Prophets. We make no distinction between any of them and to Him do we submit.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say: "We believe in Allah and in what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down to Ibrahim, Isma`il, Ishaq, Ya`qub and Al-Asbat, and what was given to Musa, `Isa and the Prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between one another among them and to Him (Allah) we have submitted."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad): We believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto us and that which was revealed unto Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the tribes, and that which was vouchsafed unto Moses and Jesus and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and unto Him we have surrendered.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Say, ‘We have faith in Allah and in what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, and that which Moses, Jesus and the prophets were given by their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and to Him do we submit.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say: 'We believe in Allah and in what is sent down to us and in that which was sent down to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the tribes, and in that which was given to (Prophets) Moses and Jesus, and the Prophets from their Lord. We do not differentiate between any of them. To Him we are submitters (Muslims)'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, "We have believed in Allah and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), say, "We believe in God and in that which has been revealed to us and in that which was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and their descendants. We believe in that which was given to Moses, Jesus, and the Prophets by their Lord. We make no distinction between them and we have submitted ourselves to the will of God".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Say: We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us, and what was revealed to Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq and Yaqoub and the tribes, and what was given to Musa and Isa and to the prophets from their Lord; we do not make any distinction between any of them, and to Him do we submit.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Say, "We believe in God and in what has been sent down to us and to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes. We believe in what has been given to Moses, Jesus and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them. It is to Him that we have surrendered ourselves."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Say: "We believe in Allah, and in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, and in (the Books) given to Moses, Jesus, and the prophets, from their Lord: We make no distinction between one and another among them, and to Allah do we bow our will (in Islam)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Musa with Our signs and a manifest authority.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), and a manifest authority,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs, and a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Verily We sent Moses with Our Signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa with Our Ayat, and a manifest authority,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and with clear authority

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our miracles and clear authority.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Musa with Our communications and clear authority,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Of old We sent Moses, with Our Signs and an authority manifest,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Let me kill Moses," the Pharaoh said, "and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he will change your faith and spread corruption in the land."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Pharaoh said, 'Let me slay Moses, and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he may change, your religion, or that he may cause corruption to appear in the land.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Fir'awn said: let me alone, that may slay Musa, and let him call upon his Lord. Verily fear that he may change your religion or that he may cause to appear in the land corruption.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Leave me to kill Musa (Moses), and let him call his Lord (to stop me from killing him)! I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh said, “Leave me to kill Moses, and let him appeal to his Lord. I fear he may change your religion, or spread disorder in the land.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: One day Pharaoh said: “Let me go and kill Moses; then let him invoke his Lord. I fear that he will change your religion or cause disruption in the land.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Fir`awn said: "Leave me to kill Musa, and let him call his Lord! I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto his Lord. Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he will cause confusion in the land.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Pharaoh said, ‘Let me slay Moses, and let him invoke his Lord. Indeed I fear that he will change your religion, or bring forth corruption in our land.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh said: 'Let me kill Moses, then let him call to his Lord! I am fearful that he will change your religion or cause mischief in the land'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption in the land."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call for help from his Lord. I am afraid that he will change your religion or spread evil through the land.".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon said: Let me alone that I may slay Musa and let him call upon his Lord; surely I fear that he will change your religion or that he will make mischief to appear in the land.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses, let him call upon his Lord, I fear that he may cause you to change your religion, or that he may cause disorder in the land."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Pharaoh: "Leave me to slay Moses; and let him call on his Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion, or lest he should cause mischief to appear in the land!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every insolent imposter who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Moses said, 'I take refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every man who is proud, and believes not in the Day of Reckoning.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Musa said: verily I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every stiff-necked person who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Verily, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the Day of Reckoning!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “I have sought the protection of my Lord and your Lord, from every tyrant who does not believe in the Day of Account.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: “I have taken refuge with my Lord and your Lord from everyone who waxes arrogant and does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said: "Verily, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the Day of Reckoning!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said: Lo! I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every scorner who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said, ‘I seek the protection of my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said: 'I take refuge in my Lord and in your Lord from every proud (person), who does not believe in Day of Reckoning'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "I seek protection from your and my Lord against every arrogant person who has no faith in the Day of Judgment."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Musa said: Surely I take refuge with my Lord and-- your Lord from every proud one who does not believe in the day of reckoning.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "I seek refuge with my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant person who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day of Account!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Of reaching the tracts of heaven and look at the god of Moses, though I think that he is a liar." Thus were the evil deeds of Pharaoh made to look attractive to him, and he was hindered from the path. So the stratagem of Pharaoh was bound to perish.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: the cords of the heavens, and look upon Moses' God; for I think that he is a liar.' So the evil of his deeds was decked out fair to Pharaoh, and he was barred from the way, and Pharaoh's guile came only to ruin.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: The way of access to the heavens so that may be apprised of the God of Musa, and verily I believe him to be a liar. And thus fair- seeming was made Unto FIr'awn the evil of his work, and he was hindered from the path. And the plot of Fir'awn ended only in ruin.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "The ways of the heavens, and I may look upon the Ilah (God) of Musa (Moses) but verily, I think him to be a liar." Thus it was made fair-seeming, in Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the (Right) Path, and the plot of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) led to nothing but loss and destruction (for him).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The pathways of the heavens, so that I may glance at the God of Moses; though I think he is lying.” Thus Pharaoh’s evil deeds were made to appear good to him, and he was averted from the path. Pharaoh's guile was only in defeat.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: the highways to the heavens -- and have a look at the God of Moses, although I am certain that Moses is a liar.” Thus Pharaoh's evil deed was made to seem fair to him, and he was barred from the Right Path. Pharaoh's guile only led him to his own perdition.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The ways of the heavens, and I may look upon the God of Musa, but verily, I think him to be a liar." Thus it was made fair seeming, in Fir`awn's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the path; and the plot of Fir`awn led to nothing but loss and destruction.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The roads of the heavens, and may look upon the god of Moses, though verily I think him a liar. Thus was the evil that he did made fairseeming unto Pharaoh, and he was debarred from the (right) way. The plot of Pharaoh ended but in ruin.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: —the routes of the heavens—and take a look at the God of Moses, and indeed I consider him a liar.’ The evil of his conduct was thus presented as decorous to Pharaoh, and he was kept from the way [of Allah]. Pharaoh’s stratagems only led him into ruin.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: the ways of heaven so that I may look upon the God of Moses, because I think that he is a liar' And so Pharaoh's evil deeds were made to seem fair to him, and he was barred from the Way. And Pharaoh's guile came to nothing except ruin.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The ways into the heavens - so that I may look at the deity of Moses; but indeed, I think he is a liar." And thus was made attractive to Pharaoh the evil of his deed, and he was averted from the [right] way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: to the heavens and be able to climb up to the Lord of Moses. I think that Moses is lying." Thus, Pharaoh's evil deeds seemed attractive to him and prevented him from the right path. The Pharaoh's plots only led him to his own destructor.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The means of access to the heavens, then reach the god of Musa, and I surely think him to be a liar. And thus the evil of his deed was made fairseeming to Firon, and he was turned away from the way; and the struggle of Firon was not (to end) in aught but destruction.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: to the heavens, so that I may look upon the God of Moses: I am convinced that he is a liar!" That is how Pharaoh's evil actions were made to look fair in the eyes of Pharoah, and he was turned away from the path [of truth]. Pharaoh's scheming led to nothing but ruin.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We showed Moses the way, and bequeathed the Book to the children of Israel,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also gave Moses the guidance, and We bequeathed upon the Children of Israel the Book

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed Unto Musa the guidance, and We caused the Children of Isra'il to inherit the Book.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture [i.e. the Taurat (Torah)],

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses guidance, and made the Children of Israel inherit the Scripture.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We surely guided Moses and made the Children of Israel the heirs of the Book

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Musa the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture --

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave guidance to Moses and We gave the Children of Israel the Book as a legacy,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave Moses the Guidance and bequeathed upon the Children of Israel the Book

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Moses guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Moses We had given guidance and to the children of Israel We had given the Book

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave Musa the guidance, and We made the children of Israel inherit the Book,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses Our guidance, and made the Children of Israel the inheritors of the Book --

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We gave Moses the Book; but they began to differ about it. If the Word of your Lord had not preceded it the matter would have been settled between them. They are still in doubt about it and uneasy.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book; and there was difference concerning it, and but for a Word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are in doubt of it disquieting.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed Unto Musa the Book, and difference arose concerning it; and had not a word gone forth from thy Lord, the affair would have been decreed between them. And verily they are in regard thereto in doubt and dubitating.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture, but dispute arose therein. And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, (the torment would have overtaken them) and the matter would have been settled between them. But truly, they are in grave doubt thereto (i.e. about the Quran). [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 15, Page 370]

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, but disputes arose concerning it. Were it not for a prior decree from your Lord, judgment would have been pronounced between them. But they are in perplexing doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And in the past We gave Moses the Book and yet it became an object of dispute. If your Lord's decree had not gone forth before, a decisive judgement would have been made among them, once and for all. Surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa the Scripture, but dispute arose therein. And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, and the matter would have been settled between them. But truly, they are in grave doubt thereto.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, but there hath been dispute concerning it; and but for a Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord, it would ere now have been judged between them; but lo! they are in hopeless doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, but differences arose about it; and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, judgement would have been made between them, for they are in grave doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses, but there were disputes about it, and had it not been for a Word that preceded from your Lord (their disputes) would have been decided between them. But they are in disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had given the Book to Moses about which people greatly disagreed. Had the word of your Lord not been decreed, He would have certainly settled their differences (there and then). They were greatly suspicious and doubtful about the Book of Moses.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave the Book to Musa, but it has been differed about, and had not a word already gone forth from your Lord, judgment would certainly have been given between them; and most surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, but differences were created concerning it: and had it not been for a word that had already gone forth from your Lord, the matter would have been decided between them; and certainly they are in grave doubt about it.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We certainly gave Moses the Book aforetime: but disputes arose therein. Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their differences) would have been settled between them: but they remained in suspicious disquieting doubt thereon.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He has laid down for you the (same) way of life and belief which He had commended to Noah, and which We have enjoined on you, and which We had bequeathed to Abraham, Moses and Jesus, so that they should maintain the order and not be divided among themselves. Heavy is to idolaters what you invite them to. God chooses whom He please for Himself, and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He has laid down for you as religion that He charged Noah with, and that We have revealed to thee, and that We charged Abraham with, Moses and Jesus: 'Perform the religion, and scatter not regarding it. Very hateful is that for the idolaters, that thou callest them to. God chooses unto Himself whomsoever He will, and He guides to Himself whosoever turns, penitent.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He hath instituted for you in religion that which He had enjoined upon Nuh, and which We have revealed Unto thee, and which We had enjoined upon Ibrahim and Musa and Isa, saying: establish the religion, and be not divided therein. Grievous Unto the associaters is that Unto which thou callest them. Allah chooseth for Himself whomsoever He will and guideth Unto Himself whomsoever turneth in penitence.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He (Allah) has ordained for you the same religion (Islam) which He ordained for Nuh (Noah), and that which We have inspired in you (O Muhammad SAW), and that which We ordained for Ibrahim (Abraham), Musa (Moses) and 'Iesa (Jesus) saying you should establish religion (i.e. to do what it orders you to do practically), and make no divisions in it (religion) (i.e. various sects in religion). Intolerable for the Mushrikun, is that to which you (O Muhammad SAW) call them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills, and guides unto Himself who turns to Him in repentance and in obedience.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He prescribed for you the same religion He enjoined upon Noah, and what We inspired to you, and what We enjoined upon Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus: “You shall uphold the religion, and be not divided therein.” As for the idolaters, what you call them to is outrageous to them. God chooses to Himself whom He wills, and He guides to Himself whoever repents.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He has prescribed for you the religion which He enjoined upon Noah and which We revealed to you (O Muhammad), and which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, commanding: “Establish this religion and do not split up regarding it.” What you are calling to is very hard upon those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Allah chooses for Himself whomsoever He pleases and guides to Himself whoever penitently turns to Him.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (Allah) has ordained for you the same religion which He ordained for Nuh, and that which We have revealed to you, and that which We ordained for Ibrahim, Musa and `Isa saying you should establish religion and make no divisions in it. Intolerable for the idolators is that to which you call them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills, and guides unto Himself who turns to Him in repentance.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He hath ordained for you that religion which He commended unto Noah, and that which We inspire in thee (Muhammad), and that which We commended unto Abraham and Moses and Jesus, saying: Establish the religion, and be not divided therein. Dreadful for the idolaters is that unto which thou callest them. Allah chooseth for Himself whom He will, and guideth unto Himself him who turneth (toward Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He has prescribed for you the religion which He had enjoined upon Noah and which We have [also] revealed to you, and which We had enjoined upon Abraham, Moses and Jesus, declaring, ‘Maintain the religion, and do not be divided in it.’ Hard on the polytheists is that to which you summon them. Allah chooses for it whomever He wishes, and He guides to it whomever returns penitently [to Him].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He has made plain for you the Religion with which He charged Noah and that which We have revealed to you, and that with which We charged (Prophets) Abraham, Moses and Jesus, (saying): 'Establish the Religion and do not be divided therein' That which you invite them to is too overwhelming for the idolaters. Allah brings close to Himself whom He will, and guides to Him those who turn in repentance.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He has plainly clarified the religion which is revealed to you and that which Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus were commanded to follow (He has explained it) so that you would be steadfast and united in your religion. What you call the pagans to is extremely grave for them. God attracts to (the religion) whomever He wants and guides to it whoever turns to Him in repentance.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He has made plain to you of the religion what He enjoined upon Nuh and that which We have revealed to you and that which We enjoined upon Ibrahim and Musa and Isa that keep to obedience and be not divided therein; hard to the unbelievers is that which you call them to; Allah chooses for Himself whom He pleases, and guides to Himself him who turns (to Him), frequently.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God has ordained for you the same religion which He enjoined on Noah, and which We have revealed to you, and which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, so that you should remain steadfast in religion and not become divided in it. What you call upon the polytheists to do is hard for them; God chooses for Himself whoever He pleases and guides towards Himself those who turn to Him.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The same religion has He established for you as that which He enjoined on Noah - the which We have sent by inspiration to thee - and that which We enjoined on Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: Namely, that ye should remain steadfast in religion, and make no divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah, hard is the (way) to which thou callest them. Allah chooses to Himself those whom He pleases, and guides to Himself those who turn (to Him).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs to the Pharaoh and his nobles. He said: "I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, and he said, 'Surely, I am the Messenger of the Lord of all Being.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Musa with Our signs Unto Fir'awn and his chiefs, and he said: verily I am an apostle of the Lord of the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We did send Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs (inviting them to Allah's Religion of Islam) He said: "Verily, I am a Messenger of the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our revelations to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. He said, “I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We sent Moses with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. He told them: “I am a Messenger of the Lord of the Universe.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We did send Musa with Our Ayat to Fir`awn and his chiefs. He said: "Verily, I am a Messenger of the Lord of all that exists."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite. He said, ‘I am indeed an apostle of the Lord of all the worlds.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, and he said: 'I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And certainly did We send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, "Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Moses to the Pharaoh and his nobles with Our miracles and he said, "I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Universe".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Musa with Our communications to Firon and his chiefs, so he said: Surely I am the apostle of the Lord of the worlds.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. He said, "I am the messenger of the Lord of the Universe,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And the Pharaoh said to his people: "O people, is not mine the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers that flow at my feet? Can you still not comprehend?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And said Firaun, “O my people! Is not the kingdom of Egypt for me, and these rivers that flow beneath me? So do you not see?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people: 'O my people, do I not possess the kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flowing beneath me? What, do you not see?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Is not mine the dominion of Egypt, and these rivers flowing underneath me. See you not then?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying, “O my people, do I not own the Kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flow beneath me? Do you not see?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people: “My people, do I not have dominion over Egypt, and are these streams not flowing beneath me? Can't you see?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Fir`awn proclaimed among his people (saying): "O my people! Is not mine the dominion of Egypt, and these rivers flowing underneath me. See you not then"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people saying: O my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me? Can ye not then discern?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed to his people, saying, ‘O my people! Do not the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers that run at my feet belong to me? Do you not perceive?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then Pharaoh made a proclamation to his people: 'My people, is the kingdom of Egypt not mine and these rivers which flow beneath me? What, can you not see?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh shouted to his people, "My people, is the kingdom of Egypt not mine? and can you not see that the streams flow from beneath my palace?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon proclaimed amongst his people: O my people! is not the kingdom of Egypt mine? And these rivers flow beneath me; do you not then see?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh called to his people, "My people, is the Kingdom of Egypt not mine? And these rivers that flow at my feet, are they not mine? Do you not see?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me, (witness) these streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: There was the Book of Moses before this, a guide and a mercy; and here is this Book confirming it in lucid language, warning those who are wicked, and giving happy tidings to the righteous.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Yet before it was the Book of Moses for a model and a mercy; and this is a Book confirming, in Arabic tongue, to warn the evildoers, and good tidings to the good-doers.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And before it there hath been the Book of Musa, a guide and a mercy. And this a Book confirming it, in Arabic speech, that it may warn those who have done wrong and as glad tidings Unto the well-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And before this was the Scripture of Musa (Moses) as a guide and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book (the Quran) in the Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong, and as glad tidings to the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And before it was the Book of Moses, a model and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book, in the Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong—and good news for the doers of good.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Yet before this the Book was revealed to Moses as a guide and a mercy. This Book, which confirms it, is in the Arabic tongue to warn the wrong-doers and to give good tidings to those who do good.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And before this was the Scripture of Musa as a guide and a mercy. And this is a Book confirming in the Arabic tongue, to warn those who do wrong, and as glad tidings for the doers of good.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When before it there was the Scripture of Moses, an example and a mercy; and this is a confirming Scripture in the Arabic language, that it may warn those who do wrong and bring good tidings for the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Yet before it the Book of Moses was a guide and mercy, and this is a Book in the Arabic language, which confirms it, [sent] to warn the wrongdoers, and is a [bearer of] good news for the virtuous.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Yet before it there was the Book of Moses which was an authority, and a mercy. This (Koran) is the Book confirming it (the other untampered Books) in theArabic tongue, to warn the harmdoers and to give glad tidings to those who do good.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Before this (Quran), the Book of Moses was a guide and a blessing. This Book confirms the Torah. It is in the Arabic language so that it may warn the unjust people, and give glad news to the righteous ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And before it the Book of Musa was a guide and a mercy: and this is a Book verifying (it) in the Arabic language that it may warn those who are unjust and as good news for the doers of good.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Yet the scripture of Moses was revealed before it as a guide and a blessing; and this is a Book in the Arabic language, fulfilling [previous prophecies], to forewarn those who do evil and to bring good news to those who do good.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And before this, was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy: And this Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the unjust, and as Glad Tidings to those who do right.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "O our people:" they said: "we have listened to a Book which has come down after Moses, confirming what was (sent down) before it, showing the way to the truth and a path that is straight.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Our people, we have heard a Book that was sent down after Moses, confirming what was before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: O our people! verily we have hearkened Unto a Book sent down after Musa, confirming that which was before it, guiding Unto the truth and a straight path.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "O our people! Verily! We have heard a Book (this Quran) sent down after Musa (Moses), confirming what came before it, it guides to the truth and to a Straight Path (i.e. Islam).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O our people, we have heard a Scripture, sent down after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth, and to a straight path.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: “Our people, We have heard a Scripture revealed after Moses, verifying the Scriptures revealed before it; it guides to the Truth and to the Straight Way.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "O our people! Verily, we have heard a Book sent down after Musa, confirming what came before it, it guides to the truth and to the straight path."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: O our people! Lo! we have heard a scripture which hath been revealed after Moses, confirming that which was before it, guiding unto the truth and a right road.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘O our people! Indeed, we have heard a Book, which has been sent down after Moses, confirming what was before it. It guides to the truth and to a straight path.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Our nation' they said: 'we have just been listening to a Book sent down after Moses confirming what came before it and guiding to the truth and to aStraight Path.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a [recited] Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it which guides to the truth and to a straight path.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and said, "Our people, we have listened to the recitation of a Book revealed after Moses. It confirms the Books revealed before and guides to the Truth and the right path.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: O our people! we have listened to a Book revealed after Musa verifying that which is before it, guiding to the truth and to a right path:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "O our people, we have heard a Book, which has been sent down after Moses, fulfilling the predictions existing in previous scriptures; it guides to the truth, and to the right path.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "O our people! We have heard a Book revealed after Moses, confirming what came before it: it guides (men) to the Truth and to a Straight Path.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The people of the Book demand of you to bring for them a book from heaven. But of Moses they had asked a bigger thing, and demanded: "Show us God face to face." They were struck by lightning then as punishment for their wickedness. Even then they made the calf, when clear signs had reached them. Still We forgave them and gave Moses clear authority.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The People of the Book will ask thee to bring down upon them a Book from heaven; and they asked Moses for greater than that, for they said, 'Show us God openly.' And the thunderbolt took them for their evildoing. Then they took to themselves the Calf, after the clear signs had come to them; yet We pardoned them that, and We bestowed upon Moses a clear authority.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: The people of the Book ask thee to bring down a Book to them from the heaven. But surely they asked Musa a thing greater than that; they said: shew us God manifestly; whencefore the thunderbolt overtook them for their wrong-doing. Then they took a calf after there had come unto them the evidences. Even so We pardoned that, and We gave Musa a manifest authority.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The people of the Scripture (Jews) ask you to cause a book to descend upon them from heaven. Indeed they asked Musa (Moses) for even greater than that, when they said: "Show us Allah in public," but they were struck with thunder clap and lightning for their wickedness. Then they worshipped the calf even after clear proofs, evidences, and signs had come to them. (Even) so We forgave them. And We gave Musa (Moses) a clear proof of authority.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The People of the Scripture challenge you to bring down to them a book from the sky. They had asked Moses for something even greater. They said, “Show us God plainly.” The thunderbolt struck them for their wickedness. Then they took the calf for worship, even after the clear proofs had come to them. Yet We pardoned that, and We gave Moses a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The People of the Book now ask of you to have a Book come down on them from heaven; indeed they asked of Moses even greater things than this, for they said: 'Make us see Allah with our own eyes' - whereupon the thunderbolt suddenly smote them for their wickedness. Then they took to worshipping the calf after clear signs had come to them. Still, We forgave them, and conferred a manifest commandment upon Moses,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The People of the Scripture (Jews) ask you to cause a book to descend upon them from heaven. Indeed, they asked Musa for even greater than that, when they said: "Show us Allah in public," but they were struck with a bolt of lightning for their wickedness. Then they worshipped the calf even after Al-Bayyinat had come to them. (Even) so We forgave them. And We gave Musa a clear proof of authority.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The people of the Scripture ask of thee that thou shouldst cause an (actual) Book to descend upon them from heaven. They asked a greater thing of Moses aforetime, for they said: Show us Allah plainly. The storm of lightning seized them for their wickedness. Then (even) after that) they chose the calf (for worship) after clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty) had come unto them. And We forgave them that! And We bestowed on Moses evident authority.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The People of the Book ask you to bring down for them a Book from the sky. Certainly they asked Moses for [something] greater than that, for they said, ‘Show us Allah visibly,’ whereat a thunderbolt seized them for their wrongdoing. Then they took up the Calf [for worship], after all the manifest proofs that had come to them. Yet We excused that, and We gave Moses a manifest authority.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The People of the Book ask you to bring down upon them a Book from heaven. Of Moses they asked greater than that, they said to him: 'Show us Allah openly' And a thunderbolt took them for their evil doing. Then they took to themselves the calf, after the clear proofs had come to them, yet We forgave that and We gave Moses clear authority.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said, "Show us Allah outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf [for worship] after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), the People of the Book ask you to make a Book descend to them from the heavens. However, they had asked Moses for things much harder to do than this, by saying, "Show us God in person." Thunder and lightning struck them because of their unjust demands. Despite all the evidence that had come to them, they started to worship the calf, but We forgave them for their sins and gave Moses clear authority.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The followers of the Book ask you to bring down to them a book from heaven; so indeed they demanded of Musa a greater thing than that, for they said: Show us Allah manifestly; so the lightning overtook them on account of their injustice. Then they took the calf (for a god), after clear signs had come to them, but We pardoned this; and We gave to Musa clear authority.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The People of the Book ask you to bring down for them a book from heaven. Of Moses they demanded a greater thing than that. They said to him: "Show us God face to face." A thunderbolt struck them for their wickedness. After that, they took to worshipping the [golden] calf, after all evidence of the truth had come to them! Yet We pardoned even that and bestowed on Moses clear authority.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The people of the Book ask thee to cause a book to descend to them from heaven: Indeed they asked Moses for an even greater (miracle), for they said: "Show us Allah in public," but they were dazed for their presumption, with thunder and lightning. Yet they worshipped the calf even after clear signs had come to them; even so we forgave them; and gave Moses manifest proofs of authority.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And to many an apostle We have mentioned before, and to many other apostles We have not mentioned to you; and to Moses God spoke directly.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and Messengers We have already told thee of before, and Messengers We have not told thee of; and unto Moses God spoke directly --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We Revealed unto apostles of some of whom We have narrated unto thee aforetime and of others of whom We have not narrated unto thee; and unto Musa Allah spake directly.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Messengers We have mentioned to you before, and Messengers We have not mentioned to you, - and to Musa (Moses) Allah spoke directly.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Some messengers We have already told you about, while some messengers We have not told you about. And God spoke to Moses directly.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We revealed to the Messengers We have already told you of, and to the Messengers We have not told you of; and to Moses Allah spoke directly.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Messengers We have mentioned to you before, and Messengers We have not mentioned to you, and to Musa Allah spoke directly.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And messengers We have mentioned unto thee before and messengers We have not mentioned unto thee; and Allah spake directly unto Moses;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and apostles We have recounted to you earlier and apostles We have not recounted to you—and to Moses Allah spoke directly—

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And Messengers of whom We have narrated to you before, and Messengers of whom We did not narrate to you. Certainly, Allah talked to Moses.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (We sent revelations to) the Messengers mentioned to you before and also to Messengers who have not been mentioned to you. God spoke to Moses in words.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And (We sent) apostles We have mentioned to you before and apostles we have not mentioned to you; and to Musa, Allah addressed His Word, speaking (to him):

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have told you about some messengers sent previously, while We have not yet told you about others. God spoke to Moses directly.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Of some messengers We have already told thee the story; of others We have not;- and to Moses Allah spoke direct;-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: As (there was) in Moses when We sent him to the Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And also in Moses, when We sent him unto Pharaoh, with a clear authority,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And in Musa also was a lesson, when We sent him Unto Fir'awn with authority manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And in Musa (Moses) (too, there is a sign). When We sent him to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with a manifest authority.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And in Moses. We sent him to Pharaoh with a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: There is also a Sign for you in the story of Moses when We sent him with a clear authority to Pharaoh.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And in Musa, when We sent him to Fir`awn with a manifest authority.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And in Moses (too, there is a portent) when We sent him unto Pharaoh with clear warrant,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And in Moses [too there is a sign] when We sent him to Pharaoh with a manifest authority.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: In Moses, too, (there were signs). We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: There is also evidence (of the Truth) in the story of Moses when We sent him to the Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And in Musa: When We sent him to Firon with clear authority.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: There is another sign in Moses: We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Has he not heard what is contained in the Book of Moses,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Or has he not been told of what is in the scrolls of Moses,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Hath he not been told of that which is in the writs of Musa.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Or is he not informed with what is in the Pages (Scripture) of Musa (Moses),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Or was he not informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Has he not been informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Or is he not informed with what is in the Suhuf of Musa,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Has he not been informed of what is in the scriptures of Moses,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Or, has he not been told of that which is in the Scrolls of Moses

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Has not he been informed of the contents of the Book of Moses

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Or, has he not been informed of what is in the scriptures of Musa?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Has he not been made acquainted with what was written in the scriptures of Moses?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Nay, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember when Moses said to his people: "O my people, remember the favours that God bestowed on you when He appointed apostles from among you, and made you kings and gave you what had never been given to any one in the world.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, remember God's blessing upon you, when He appointed among you Prophets, and appointed you kings, and gave you such as He had not given to any being.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Musa said unto his people: O my people! remember the favour of Allah on you when he made amongst you prophets and made princes, and vouchsafed unto you that which he vouchsafed not to anyone in the world.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his people: "O my people! Remember the Favour of Allah to you, when He made Prophets among you, made you kings, and gave you what He had not given to any other among the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns, in the past)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Moses said to his people, “O my people, remember God’s blessings upon you, when He placed prophets among you, and made you kings, and gave you what He never gave any other people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Remember when Moses said to his people: 'My people, remember Allah's favour upon you when He raised Prophets amongst you and appointed you rulers, and granted to you what He had not granted to anyone else in the world.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Musa said to his people: "O my people! Remember the favor of Allah to you: when He made Prophets among you, made you kings and gave you what He had not given to any other among the nations (Al-`Alamin)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when Moses said unto his people: O my people! Remember Allah's favour unto you, how He placed among you prophets, and He made you kings, and gave you that (which) He gave not to any (other) of (His) creatures.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Moses said to his people, ‘O my people, remember Allah’s blessing upon you when He appointed prophets among you, and made you kings, and gave you what none of the nations were given.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Remember) when Moses said to his people. 'Remember, my people, the favors which Allah has bestowed upon you. He has raised up Prophets among you, made you kings, and given you that which He has not given to any one of the worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors and gave you that which He had not given anyone among the worlds.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Moses told his people, "Recall God's favors to you. He made Messengers and Kings out of your own people and gave you what He had not given to others-

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Musa said to his people: O my people! remember the favor of Allah upon you when He raised prophets among you and made you kings and gave you what He had not given to any other among the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Remember when Moses said to his people, "O my people! Remember God's favour to you, He has raised up prophets among you, made you kings, and granted you [favours] such as He has not granted to anyone else in the world.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Remember Moses said to his people: "O my people! Call in remembrance the favour of Allah unto you, when He produced prophets among you, made you kings, and gave you what He had not given to any other among the peoples.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Moses, in that land live a people who are formidable; we shall never go there until they leave. We shall enter when they go away."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Moses, there are people in. it very arrogant; we will not enter it until they depart from it; if they depart from it then we will enter.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: O Musa! verily therein are a people high handed, and verily we shall never enter it until they go forth therefrom; so if they go forth thence, we shall verily enter in.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "O Musa (Moses)! In it (this holy land) are a people of great strength, and we shall never enter it, till they leave it; when they leave, then we will enter."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O Moses, there are tyrannical people in it; we will not enter it until they leave it. If they leave it, we will be entering.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They answered: 'Moses, therein live a ferocious people: we will not enter unless they depart from it; but if they do depart from it then we will surely enter it.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "O Musa! In it are a people of great strength, and we shall never enter it, till they leave it; when they leave, then we will enter."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: O Moses! Lo! a giant people (dwell) therein and lo! we go not in till they go forth from thence. When they go forth from thence, then we will enter (not till then).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘O Moses, there are a tyrannical people in it. We will not enter it until they leave it. But once they leave it, we will go in.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Moses' they replied, 'therein is a nation of giants. We will not enter until they depart from it; if they depart from it only then shall we enter'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "O Moses, indeed within it is a people of tyrannical strength, and indeed, we will never enter it until they leave it; but if they leave it, then we will enter."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "Moses, a giant race of people is living there. We shall never go there unless they leave the land first. If they leave it then we will enter."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: O Musa! surely there is a strong race in it, and we will on no account enter it until they go out from it, so if they go out from it, then surely we will enter.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Moses, in that land there is a powerful people. Never shall we enter it until they leave it: if they leave, then we shall certainly enter it."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Moses! In this land are a people of exceeding strength: Never shall we enter it until they leave it: if (once) they leave, then shall we enter."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Moses, we shall never, never enter so long as they are there. Go you and your Lord to fight them; we stay here."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Moses, we will never enter it so long as they are in it. Go forth, thou and thy Lord, and do battle; we will be sitting here.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: O Musa! verily we shall never enter it so long as they remain therein; go thou and thy Lord, and fight ye twain, we shall remain here sitting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "O Musa (Moses)! We shall never enter it as long as they are there. So go you and your Lord and fight you two, we are sitting right here."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O Moses, we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are in it. So go ahead, you and your Lord, and fight. We are staying right here.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Nevertheless they said: 'O Moses! Never shall we enter it as long as they are there. Go forth, then, you and your Lord, and fight, both of you. As for us, we will sit here.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "O Musa! We shall never enter it as long as they are there. So go, you and your Lord, and fight you two, we are sitting right here."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: O Moses! We will never enter (the land) while they are in it. So go thou and thy Lord and fight! We will sit here.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘O Moses, we will never enter it so long as they remain in it. Go ahead, you and your Lord, and fight! We will be sitting right here.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Moses, we will never go in so long as they are in it. Go, you and your Lord, to fight. We will stay here'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "O Moses, indeed we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are within it; so go, you and your Lord, and fight. Indeed, we are remaining right here."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "(Moses), as long as they are in the land, we shall never go there. Go with your Lord to fight them but we shall stay where we are".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: O Musa! we shall never enter it so long as they are in it; go therefore you and your Lord, then fight you both surely we will here sit down.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "We will never enter it, Moses, as long as they are there. Go, you and your Lord, and fight, and we will stay here."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Moses! while they remain there, never shall we be able to enter, to the end of time. Go thou, and thy Lord, and fight ye two, while we sit here (and watch)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Moses said to his people: "O my people, why do you afflict me though you know that I have been sent to you by God?" But when they turned aside God made their hearts turn farther away; for God does not show the transgressors the way.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, why do you hurt me, though you know I am the Messenger of God to you?' When they swerved, God caused their hearts to swerve; and God. guides never the people of the ungodly.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Musa said Unto his people: O my people! wherefore hurt ye me, When surely ye know that verily I am Allah's apostle Unto you! Then when they sweryed, Allah made their hearts swerve; and Allah guideth not a transgressing people.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his people: "O my people! Why do you hurt me while you know certainly that I am the Messenger of Allah to you? So when they turned away (from the Path of Allah), Allah turned their hearts away (from the Right Path). And Allah guides not the people who are Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Moses said to his people, “O my people, why do you hurt me, although you know that I am God’s Messenger to you?” And when they swerved, God swerved their hearts. God does not guide the sinful people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: “O my people, why do you torment me when you know well that I am Allah's Messenger to you?” So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviant. Allah does not direct the evil-doers to the Right Way.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when Musa said to his people: "O my people! Why do you annoy me while you know certainly that I am the Messenger of Allah to you So, when they turned away (from the path of Allah), Allah turned their hearts away (from the right path). And Allah guides not the people who are rebellious.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when Moses said unto his people: O my people! Why persecute ye me, when ye well know that I am Allah's messenger unto you? So when they went astray Allah sent their hearts astray. And Allah guideth not the evil-living folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Moses said to his people, ‘O my people! Why do you torment me, when you certainly know that I am Allah’s apostle to you?’ So when they swerved [from the right path], Allah made their hearts swerve, and Allah does not guide the transgressing lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Moses, said to his nation: 'Why do you harm me, when you know that I am the Messenger of Allah sent to you' But when they swerved away Allah caused their hearts to swerve. Allah never guides impious people.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?" And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

translation.author: Sarwar
