translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people, who are a wicked lot indeed."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Thrust thy hand in thy bosom and it will come forth white without evil-among nine signs to Pharaoh and his people; they are an ungodly people.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And put your hand into your bosom, it will come forth white without hurt. (These are) among the nine signs (you will take) to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his people, they are a people who are the Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Put your hand inside your pocket, and it will come out white, without blemish—among nine miracles to Pharaoh and his people, for they are immoral people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Now put your hand into your bosom, and it will come forth shining without any blemish. (These are two of the) nine Signs to be carried to Pharaoh and his people. They are surely a wicked people."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And put thy hand into the bosom of thy robe, it will come forth white but unhurt. (This will be one) among nine tokens unto Pharaoh and his people Lo! they were ever evil-living folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Insert your hand into your shirt. It will emerge white and bright, without any fault—among nine signs meant for Pharaoh and his people. Indeed they are a transgressing lot.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Put your hand inside your collar and it will come out luminous without evil? among the nine signs to Pharaoh and his nation, indeed they were an impious nation'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Put your hand into your pocket. It will come out sheer white but unharmed. This is one of the nine miracles which shall be showing to the Pharaoh and his people; they are truly wicked men."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Now put your hand inside your cloak next to your bosom and it will come out [shining] white, without any blemish. This will be one of the nine signs for Pharaoh and his people: for truly they are a rebellious people."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Now put thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm): (these are) among the nine Signs (thou wilt take) to Pharaoh and his people: for they are a people rebellious in transgression."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Put your hand inside your shirt. It will come out white without a tarnish of blame; and do not be perturbed or afraid. These are two proofs from your Lord for the Pharaoh and his nobles. They are certainly a rebellious people."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Insert thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without evil; and press to thee thy arm, that thou be not afraid. So these shall be two proofs from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Council; for surely they are an ungodly people.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Put your hand in your bosom, it will come forth white without a disease, and draw your hand close to your side to be free from fear (that which you suffered from the snake, and also by that your hand will return to its original state). these are two Burhan (signs, miracles, evidences, proofs) from your Lord to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs. Verily, they are the people who are Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Put your hand inside your pocket, and it will come out white, without blemish. And press your arm to your side, against fear. These are two proofs from your Lord, to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. They are truly sinful people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Put your hand into your bosom, and it will come out shining without any blemish; and draw your hand close to your body to still your fear. Those are the two clear Signs from your Lord for Pharaoh and his chiefs, for truly they are a disobedient people."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Thrust thy hand into the bosom of thy robe it will come forth white without hurt. And guard thy heart from fear. Then these shall be two proofs from your Lord unto Pharaoh and his chiefs. Lo! they are evil-living folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Insert your hand into your shirt. It will emerge white, without any fault, and keep your arms drawn in awe to your sides. These shall be two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his elite. They are indeed a transgressing lot.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Put your hand in the neck (of your shirt), it will come out luminous, unharmed, and draw your arm to you so that you are not afraid. These are two signs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his Assembly. Surely, they were an impious nation.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white, without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Place your hand in your pocket; it will come out sheer white but not sick. Be humble for fear of God and show these two miracles of your Lord to the Pharaoh and his officials; they are an evil-doing people."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Put your hand into your bosom; it will come out [shining] white, without blemish; now draw your arm close to your body to calm your fears. These are two credentials from your Lord for Pharaoh and his nobles. Surely, they are a rebellious people."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Move thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm), and draw thy hand close to thy side (to guard) against fear. Those are the two credentials from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: for truly they are a people rebellious and wicked."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The Pharaoh had become high and mighty in the land, and divided the people into different classes, and impoverished one class, slaying its males and sparing its women, for he was indeed a tyrant.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Now Pharaoh had exalted himself in the land and had divided its inhabitants into sects, abasing one party of them, slaughtering their sons, and sparing their women; for he was of the workers of corruption.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, Fir'aun (Pharaoh) exalted himself in the land and made its people sects, weakening (oppressing) a group (i.e. Children of Israel) among them, killing their sons, and letting their females live. Verily, he was of the Mufsidun (i.e. those who commit great sins and crimes, oppressors, tyrants, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh exalted himself in the land, and divided its people into factions. He persecuted a group of them, slaughtering their sons, while sparing their daughters. He was truly a corrupter.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed Pharaoh transgressed in the land and divided its people into sections. One group of them he humiliated, and slew their sons and spared their daughters. Truly he was among the mischief-makers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Pharaoh exalted himself in the earth and made its people castes. A tribe among them he oppressed, killing their sons and sparing their women. Lo! he was of those who work corruption.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed Pharaoh tyrannized over the land, reducing its people to factions, abasing one group of them, slaughtering their sons, and sparing their women. Indeed, He was one of the agents of corruption.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh had exalted himself in the land and had divided its people into sects, one group he abased, putting their sons to death and sparing their women, for he was one of those who corrupted.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh dominated the land and divided its inhabitants into different groups, suppressing one group by killing their sons and keeping their women alive. He was certainly an evil-doer.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh behaved arrogantly in the land, and divided the people into groups, seeking to weaken one section, slaying their sons and sparing their daughters, he was one of those who spread corruption,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Truly Pharaoh elated himself in the land and broke up its people into sections, depressing a small group among them: their sons he slew, but he kept alive their females: for he was indeed a maker of mischief.

translation.text: To establish a firm place for them in the land, and to show Pharaoh, Haman, and their hosts, at their hands, the very things against which they were taking precautions.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he was picked up by the family of Pharaoh (unaware) that he would become their enemy and a cause for regret. Surely the Pharaoh, Haman and their hordes were habitual sinners.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So then the folk of Pharaoh picked him out to be an enemy and a sorrow to them; certainly Pharaoh and Haman, and their hosts, were of the sinners.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then the household of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) picked him up, that he might become for them an enemy and a (cause of) grief. Verily! Fir'aun (Pharaoh), Haman and their hosts were sinners.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh’s household picked him up, to be an opponent and a sorrow for them. Pharaoh, Hamaan, and their troops were sinners.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then Pharaoh's household picked him up (from the river) that he may be their adversary and be a cause of sorrow to them. Surely Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts erred (in their scheming).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the family of Pharaoh took him up, that he might become for them an enemy and a sorrow, Lo! Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were ever sinning.

translation.author: Qarai

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish

translation.author: Saheeh International

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of the Pharaoh picked him up (without realizing) that he would become their enemy and a source of their sorrow. The Pharaoh, Haman, and their army were sinful people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then Pharaoh's household picked him up -- later to become for them an enemy and a source of grief for them: Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were wrongdoers --

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (It was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were men of sin.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O my people, authority is yours today being the most powerful in the land; but who will save us from the scourge of God if it fall upon us?" "I show you," said the Pharaoh, "only what I see (is right), and guide you but to the right path."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: O my people, today the kingdom is yours, who are masters in the land. But who will help us, against the might of God, if it comes upon us?' Said Pharaoh, 'I only let you see what I see; I only guide you in the way of rectitude.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my people! Yours is the kingdom this day, you are uppermost in the land. But who will save us from the Torment of Allah, should it befall us?" Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "I show you only that which I see (correct), and I guide you only to the path of right policy!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O my people! Yours is the dominion today, supreme in the land; but who will help us against God’s might, should it fall upon us?” Pharaoh said, “I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the path of prudence.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?” Pharaoh said: “I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude.”

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O my people! Yours is the kingdom to-day, ye being uppermost in the land. But who would save us from the wrath of Allah should it reach us? Pharaoh said: I do but show you what I think, and I do but guide you to wise policy.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O my people! Today sovereignty belongs to you, and you are dominant in the land. But who will save us from Allah’s punishment should it overtake us?’ Pharaoh said, ‘I just point out to you what I see [to be advisable for you], and I guide you only to the way of rectitude.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: O my nation, today the kingdom is yours and you are the masters in the land. But, if the might of Allah should come against us, who will help us' Pharaoh said: 'I only let you see what I see. I guide you to the path of righteousness'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O my people, sovereignty is yours today, [your being] dominant in the land. But who would protect us from the punishment of Allah if it came to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: My people, today you have the kingdom and the power on earth but who will help us against the wrath of God if it will befall us?" The Pharaoh said, "I show you only what I think is proper and guide you only to the right direction".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: My people! Yours is the kingdom today, you have dominion in the land; but who will help us against the scourge of God if it befalls us?" But Pharaoh said, "I point out to you only that which I consider right; and I guide you to the right path."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O my People! Yours is the dominion this day: Ye have the upper hand in the land: but who will help us from the Punishment of Allah, should it befall us?" Pharaoh said: "I but point out to you that which I see (myself); Nor do I guide you but to the Path of Right!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We then made the people who were weak (and oppressed) successors of the land to the East and the West which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the children of Israel was fulfilled, for they were patient in adversity; and whatsoever the Pharaoh and his people had fashioned, and the structures they had raised, were destroyed.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We bequeathed upon the people that were abased all the east and the west of the land We had blessed; and perfectly was fulfilled the most fair word of thy Lord upon the Children of Israel, for that they endured patiently; and We destroyed utterly the works of Pharaoh and his people, and what they had been building.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We made the people who were considered weak to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We have blessed. And the fair Word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because of their endurance. And We destroyed completely all the great works and buildings which Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his people erected.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We made the oppressed people inherit the eastern and western parts of the land, which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the Children of Israel was fulfilled, because of their endurance. And We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had built, and what they had harvested.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We made those who had been persecuted inherit the eastern and western lands which We had blessed. Thus your Lord's gracious promise was fulfilled to the Children of Israel, for they had endured with patience; and We destroyed all that Pharaoh and his people had wrought, and all that they had built.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We caused the folk who were despised to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We had blessed. And the fair word of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their endurance; and We annihilated (all) that Pharaoh and his folk had done and that they had contrived.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We made the people who were abased the heirs to the east and west of the land which We had blessed, and your Lord’s best word [of promise] was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their patience, and We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had built and what they used to erect.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave the persecuted nation dominion over the eastern and western lands which We had blessed. So the Word of your Lord, the finest, was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their patience; and We destroyed the edifices, and towers of Pharaoh and whatsoever they manufactured.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the suppressed people the blessed eastern and western regions as their inheritance. Thus, the promises of your Lord to the children of Israel all came true because of the patience which they exercised. He destroyed all the establishments of the Pharaoh and his people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We made the people who were considered weak inheritors of the eastern parts and western parts of the land which We had blessed. Thus your Lord's good promise to the Children of Israel was fulfilled, because of their patience, and We destroyed all that Pharaoh and his people had built and all that they had raised high.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Of Pharaoh and Thamud come to you?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh and Thamood?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and Thamud?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Of Pharaoh and Thamood?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: the armies of Pharaoh and Thamud?

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Of Pharaoh and (the tribe of) Thamud?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: of Pharaoh and Thamud?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: of Pharaoh and of Thamood?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Those of] Pharaoh and Thamud?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: of the Pharaoh and Thamud?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: of Pharaoh and Thamud?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Of Pharaoh and the Thamud?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And the mighty Pharaoh

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (with) Fir'aun (Pharaoh), who had pegs (who used to torture men by binding them to pegs)?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Pharaoh of the Stakes.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And with Pharaoh of the tent pegs

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And with Pharaoh, firm of might,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and Pharaoh, the impaler

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And Pharaoh, of the pegs (impaling his victims)?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Also consider the people of) the Pharaoh who victimized people by placing them on the stake,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and with Pharaoh of the stakes?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So they set out till they (came to the quay) and went on board a ship in which he made a hole, (and Moses said:) "You have made a hole in the boat to drown its passengers? You have done a strange thing!"

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then the twain journeyed until when they embarked in a boat, he scuttled it. Musa said: hast thou scuttled it that thou mayest drown the people thereof? Assuredly thou hast committed a thing grievous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they both proceeded, till, when they embarked the ship, he (Khidr) scuttled it. Musa (Moses) said: "Have you scuttled it in order to drown its people? Verily, you have committed a thing "Imra" (a Munkar - evil, bad, dreadful thing)."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then the two went forth until, when they embarked on the boat, he made a hole in it, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "Have you made a hole in it so as to drown the people in the boat? You have certainly done an awful thing."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So they both proceeded, till, when they boarded the boat, he (Khidr) damaged it. Musa said: "Have you damaged it wherein its people will drown Verily, you have committed a thing Imr."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: So they twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a hole therein. (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole therein to drown the folk thereof? Thou verily hast done a dreadful thing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They started their journey and some time latter they embarked in a boat in which he made a hole. Moses asked him, "Did you make the hole to drown the people on board? This is certainly very strange".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So they went (their way) until when they embarked in the boat he made a hole in it. (Musa) said: Have you made a hole in it to drown its inmates? Certainly you have done a grievous thing.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So they set out, but, when they got into a boat, the man made a hole in it. Moses exclaimed, "Have you made a hole in the boat to drown the people in it? You have indeed done a dreadful thing!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they both proceeded: until, when they were in the boat, he scuttled it. Said Moses: "Hast thou scuttled it in order to drown those in it? Truly a strange thing hast thou done!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: the people of Pharaoh; will they not be godfearing?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh). Will they not fear Allah and become righteous?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: the people of Pharaoh: do they have no fear?"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not be wary [of Allah]?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: the nation of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Me'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: the people of Pharaoh, will they not fear God?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "The people of the Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said [to Musa (Moses)]: "Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you did dwell many years of your life with us.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Fir`awn) said (to Musa): "Did we not bring you up among us as a child And you did dwell many years of your life with us."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said (unto Moses): Did we not rear thee among us as a child? And thou didst dwell many years of thy life among us,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He [i.e. Pharaoh] said, ‘Did we not rear you as a child among us, and did you not stay with us for years of your life?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) said (to Moses): 'Did We not bring you up when you were a child? And have you not spent years of your life amongst us?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "Did we not bring you up in our home as an infant and did you not live with us for many years

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said to Moses, "Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you spent several years of your life with us.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us, and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'And what is the Lord of all Being?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh said, “And what is the Lord of the Worlds?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh said: 'And what is the Lord of the Worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked, "Who is the Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "What is this: Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "And what is the 'Lord and Cherisher of the worlds'?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said Pharaoh, 'You have believed him before I gave you leave. Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; now you shall know! I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you all together.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "You have believed in him before I give you leave. Surely, he indeed is your chief, who has taught you magic! So verily, you shall come to know. Verily, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "You accepted the word of Moses even before I granted you the leave to do so. Surely he is your chief who has taught you magic. Soon shall you come to know. I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and shall crucify all of you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know. Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you every one.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He [i.e. Pharaoh] said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I should permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Soon you will know! I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will crucify you all.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) said: 'You have believed him before I have given you permission. He is the chief of you who has taught you sorcery. But you shall know. I will surely cut off on opposite sides a hand and a foot, and crucify you all.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "You believed without my permission? He seems to be your chief who has taught you magic. But you will soon know (the result of what you have done).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Have you come to believe in him, before I have given you permission? He is surely your master who has taught you magic. But you shall see. I will cut off your hands and feet on alternate sides and crucify you all."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? surely he is your leader, who has taught you sorcery! but soon shall ye know! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Cried lies before them the people of Noah, and Ad, and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Before them (were many who) belied Messengers, the people of Nuh (Noah); and 'Ad; and Fir'aun (Pharaoh) the man of stakes (with which he used to punish the people),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth; as did Aad, and Pharaoh of the Stakes.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah, Ad, and Pharaoh of the tent-pegs gave the lie (to the Messengers)

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did the tribe of) A'ad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Before them Noah’s people impugned [their apostle] and [so did the people of] ‘Ad, and Pharaoh, the Impaler [of his victims],

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before them the nations of Noah, Aad and Pharaoh, and he of the tentpegs belied,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of Noah, Ad and the dominating Pharaoh had rejected Our revelations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, as did the 'Ad and Pharaoh of the Stakes,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And God presents the example of Pharaoh's wife for those who believe, when she said: "O Lord, build me a house in Paradise, and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds, and save me from a wicked people;"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: God has struck a similitude for the believers -- the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, 'My Lord, build for me a house in Paradise, in Thy presence, and deliver me from Pharaoh and his work, and do Thou deliver me from the people of the evildoers.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Allah has set forth an example for those who believe, the wife of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), when she said: "My Lord! Build for me a home with You in Paradise, and save me from Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his work, and save me from the people who are Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers and disbelievers in Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And God illustrates an example of those who believe: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, “My Lord, build for me, with you, a house in Paradise, and save me from Pharaoh and his works, and save me from the wrongdoing people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Allah has set forth for the believers the parable of Pharaoh's wife. She prayed: “My Lord, build for me a house with You in Paradise and deliver me from Pharaoh and his misdeeds; and deliver me from the iniquitous people.”

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Allah citeth an example for those who believe: the wife of Pharaoh when she said: My Lord! Build for me a home with thee in the Garden, and deliver me from Pharaoh and his work, and deliver me from evil-doing folk;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Allah cites an example of the faithful: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, ‘My Lord! Build me a home near You in paradise, and deliver me from Pharaoh and his conduct, and deliver me from the wrongdoing lot.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To the believers, as a parable, God has told the story of the wife of the Pharaoh who said, "Lord, establish for me a house in Paradise in your presence. Rescue me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the unjust people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: To the believers God has given the example of Pharaoh's wife who said: "My Lord, build me a house in nearness to You in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his misdeeds. Save me from all evil-doers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Allah sets forth, as an example to those who believe the wife of Pharaoh: Behold she said: "O my Lord! Build for me, in nearness to Thee, a mansion in the Garden, and save me from Pharaoh and his doings, and save me from those that do wrong";

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then came the Pharaoh, and those before him whose habitations were overthrown while they were committing crimes.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh likewise, and those before him, and the Subverted Cities -- they committed error,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Fir'aun (Pharaoh), and those before him, and the cities overthrown [the towns of the people of [Lout (Lot)] committed sin,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then Pharaoh came, and those before him, and the Overturned Cities steeped in sin.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh and those before him and the people of the overturned habitations all engaged in the same great sin.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh and those before him, and the communities that were destroyed, brought error,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Pharaoh and those who were before him, and the towns that were overturned, brought about iniquity.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Similarly, Pharaoh, and those before him, and the ruined villages, sinned

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh, those who lived before him and the people of the Subverted Cities all persisted in doing evil.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Pharaoh, and those before him, and the Cities Overthrown, committed habitual Sin.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We have sent an Apostle to you as a witness against you, as We had sent an apostle to the Pharaoh.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Surely We have sent unto you a Messenger as a witness over you, even as We sent to Pharaoh a Messenger,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, We have sent to you (O men) a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) to be a witness over you, as We did send a Messenger [Musa (Moses)] to Fir'aun (Pharaoh).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We have sent to you a messenger, a witness over you, as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness over you, just as We had sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! We have sent unto you a messenger as witness against you, even as We sent unto Pharaoh a messenger.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed We have sent to you an apostle, to be a witness to you, just as We sent an apostle to Pharaoh.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness over you, just as We sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have sent you a Messenger, who will witness your deeds, just as We sent a Messenger to the Pharaoh.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We have sent to you, (O men!) a messenger, to be a witness concerning you, even as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But the Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle; so We seized him with a grievous punishment.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: but Pharaoh rebelled against the Messenger, so We seized him remorselessly.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: But Fir'aun (Pharaoh) disobeyed the Messenger [Musa (Moses)], so We seized him with a severe punishment.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But Pharaoh defied the Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But Pharaoh disobeyed Our Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But Pharaoh rebelled against the messenger, whereupon We seized him with no gentle grip.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle; so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh disobeyed Our Messenger, so We seized him remorselessly.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: However, the Pharaoh disobeyed the Messenger and We seized him with a severe retribution.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger; so We seized him with a heavy Punishment.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "You will find me patient if God wills," said Moses; "and I will not disobey you in any thing."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: thou wilt find me, if Allah will, patient, and shall not disobey thee in any affair.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "If Allah will, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in aught."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses replied: "You shall find me, if Allah wills, patient; and I shall not disobey you in anything."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said: "If Allah wills, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in aught."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Moses) said: 'If Allah wills, you shall find me patient, I shall not disobey your order'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "If God wishes, you will find me patient and I shall not disobey any of your orders."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "God willing, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in any thing."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "Thou wilt find me, if Allah so will, (truly) patient: nor shall I disobey thee in aught."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "If I ask you any thing again then do not keep me with you. You have my apology."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: if I ask thee regarding aught after this, company not with me; surely there hath reached to thee from my side an excuse.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "If I ask you anything after this, keep me not in your company, you have received an excuse from me."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Keep me no more in your company if I question you concerning anything after this. You will then be fully justified."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Moses) said: If I ask thee after this concerning aught, keep not company with me. Thou hast received an excuse from me.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Moses) said: 'If I question you again do not let me be your companion; you already have enough excuse'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "If I ask you such questions again, abandon me; you will have enough reason to do so."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "If I ever ask you about anything after this, do not let me accompany you. I will have given you sufficient excuse."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this, keep me not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full) excuse from my side."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "O my Lord, enlarge my breast,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Lord, open my breast,' said Moses,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "O my Lord! Open for me my chest (grant me self-confidence, contentment, and boldness).

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Lord! Open my breast for me;

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Moses) said: My Lord! relieve my mind

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Lord' said Moses, 'expand my chest,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "Lord, grant me courage.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "My Lord! open up my heart,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) replied: "Knowledge of that is with my Lord (recorded) in the Book. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said Moses, 'The knowledge of them is with my Lord, in a Book; my Lord goes not astray, nor forgets --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: the knowledge there of is with my Lord in the Book; my Lord erreth not, nor He forgetteth.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord is neither unaware nor He forgets, "

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Its knowledge is with my Lord, recorded in the Book. My Lord does not err, nor does He forget."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Musa] said: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Moses) answered: 'The knowledge of them is in a Book with My Lord. My Lord neither goes astray, nor forgets.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses replied, "The knowledge about it is with my Lord in the Book. My Lord is free from error and forgetfulness.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "My Lord alone has knowledge of that, recorded in a Book. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "You have come to believe without my dispensation. Surely he is your chief who taught you magic. I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides and crucify you on the trunks of date-palm trees. You will come to know whose punishment is harder and protracted."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'Have you believed him before I gave you leave? Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you upon the trunks of palm-trees; you shall know of a certainty which of us is more terrible in chastisement, and more abiding.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Believe you in him [Musa (Moses)] before I give you permission? Verily! He is your chief who taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you on the trunks of date-palms, and you shall surely know which of us [I (Fir'aun - Pharaoh) or the Lord of Musa (Moses) (Allah)] can give the severe and more lasting torment."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "What! Did you believe in Him even before I permitted you to do so? Surely, he must be your chief who taught you magic. Now I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and will crucify you on the trunks of palm-trees, and then you will come to know which of us can inflict sterner and more lasting torment."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he is your chief who taught you magic. Now surely I shall cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and I shall crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and ye shall know for certain which of us hath sterner and more lasting punishment.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Have you believed him before I have given you permission' he (Pharaoh) said. 'Indeed, he (must be) your chief, the one who taught you sorcery. I will cut off on opposite sides a hand and a foot then crucify you on the trunks of palmtrees. Indeed, you shall know whose punishment is more stern, and more lasting'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "Since you believed in him without my permission, then Moses certainly must be your chief who has taught you magic. I shall cut your hands and feet on alternate sides and crucify you on the trunk of the palm-tree. You shall certainly find which among us can afflict a more severe and lasting punishment".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Have you believed in him before I permit you? He must be your master who has taught you magic. I will cut your hands and feet off on opposite sides, and have you crucified on the trunks of palm-trees. You shall know whose punishment is more severe and more lasting."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader, who has taught you magic! be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: so shall ye know for certain, which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting punishment!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses answered: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you were only to believe."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye had but sure belief.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'He' (Moses) replied: 'is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you believe'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses replied, "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you want to be certain".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if only you would be convinced."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "But that is exactly what we were seeking." So they retraced their steps.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: that is that which we have been seeking. So they turned back upon their footsteps, retracing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "That is what we have been seeking." So they went back retracing their footsteps.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "That is what we were looking for." So the two turned back, retracing their footsteps,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Musa] said: "That is what we have been seeking." So they went back retracing their footsteps.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "That is exactly what we are seeking. They followed their own foot prints back (to the rock)."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "That is just what we were looking for." So they went back the way they had come,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after:" So they went back on their footsteps, following (the path they had come).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Do not hold me for having forgotten, and do not reprove me and make my task difficult."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: take me not to task for that forget, and impose not in my affair hardship.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Call me not to account for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my affair (with you)."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Do not take me to task at my forgetfulness, and do not be hard on me."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my fault.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said: 'Do not blame me for what I forgot, nor press me to do something which is too difficult'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "Please, forgive my forgetfulness. Do not oblige me with what is difficult for me to endure."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting, nor grieve me by raising difficulties in my case."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "I did it then, when I was an ignorant (as regards my Lord and His Message).

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses replied: "I committed that act erringly.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said: "I did it then, when I was in error."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Moses) replied: 'Indeed, I did that when I was among those who stray.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "I did do it and I made a mistake.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "I did that when I was one of the misguided,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "I did it then, when I was in error.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Do you not hear (what he says)?"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear (what he says)?"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Do you not hear' said he (Pharaoh) to those around him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said to the people around him, "Did you hear that?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said to those around him, "Did you hear?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: 'Surely, the Messenger who has been sent to you is mad!'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "The Messengers who has been sent to you is certainly insane".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "This messenger who has been sent to you is surely possessed!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses continued: "(He is) the Lord of the east and the west, and all between them. If you only had any understanding!"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'He is the Lord of the East and the West' said he (Moses), 'and all that is between them, if you could understand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses continued, "He is the Lord of the East and West and all that is between them, if only you would think".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "He is the Lord of the East and the West, and all that lies between them, if only you could understand."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "If you choose an ilah (god) other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly shall place thee among the prisoners.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'If you take any other god except myself' he (Pharaoh) replied, 'you shall be thrown into prison'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "If you put forward any god other than me, I will surely put you in prison".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "If you take any deity other than myself, I will throw you into prison,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "Then bring it if you are truthful at all."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) replied: 'Show us your sign, if you are of the truthful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh replied, "Bring it, if you are telling the truth."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Show it then, if you are telling the truth!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said to the chiefs around him: "Verily! This is indeed a well-versed sorcerer.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said to the nobles around him: "Surely this man is a skilled magician

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo! this is verily a knowing wizard,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'This', said he (Pharaoh) to his Council, 'is a cunning sorcerer

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said to the people around him, "He is certainly a skillful magician.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, "Surely this man is a skilful sorcerer.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So they cast their ropes and rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall be victorious."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So they cast their ropes and their staffs, and said, 'By the might of Pharaoh we shall be the victors.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said: "By the might of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), it is we who will certainly win!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said, “By the majesty of Pharaoh, we will be the winners.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon they threw down their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall prevail."

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So they threw down their sticks and ropes, and said, ‘By the might of Pharaoh, we shall surely be victorious!’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: So they cast down their ropes and staffs saying, "By the honor of the Pharaoh we shall certainly become the winners".

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Pharaoh, it is we who will certainly win!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: by no means; verily with me is my Lord; He shall guide me.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily! With me is my Lord, He will guide me."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "Nay, verily with me is my Lord. He will guide me."

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the two groups came close to each other, the companions of Moses said, "We will be caught".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "No, My Lord is with me, and He will guide me."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "This is (agreed) between you and me. Whichever term I fulfil, no injustice will be done to me. God is witness to our agreement."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: be that between me and thee: whichsoever of the two terms I shall fulfil, it shall be no harshness to me; and of that which we say Allah is Trustee.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He [Musa (Moses)] said: "That (is settled) between me and you whichever of the two terms I fulfill, there will be no injustice to me, and Allah is Surety over what we say."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses replied: "So that is agreed between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I fulfil, I trust that I shall not be wronged. Allah is a witness over the covenant we are committing ourselves to."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (Musa) said: "That (is settled) between me and you: whichever of the two terms I fulfill, there will be no injustice to me, and Allah is Surety over what we say."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'So be it between me and you' said Moses. 'Whichever of the two terms I fulfill, it will be no injustice to me. Allah is the Guardian of what we say'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "That is [established] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete - there is no injustice to me, and Allah, over what we say, is Witness."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Moses) said, "Let it be a binding contract between us and I shall be free to serve for any of the said terms. God will bear witness to our agreement."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "That is agreed between me and you; whichever of the two terms I fulfil, there will be no blame on me. God is witness to what we say."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had tried the people of Pharaoh before them. A respected prophet had come to them (saying):

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Already before them We tried the people of Pharaoh, and a noble Messenger came unto them,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We tried before them Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people, when there came to them a noble Messenger [i.e. Musa (Moses)],

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them We tested the people of Pharaoh; a noble messenger came to them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We tried the people of Pharaoh before them, when a noble apostle came to them,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had certainly tested the people of the Pharaoh before them to whom a noble Messengers had come, saying,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We tried the people of Pharaoh before them: a noble messenger was sent to them,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did, before them, try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them a messenger most honourable,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "O Lord, forgive me and my brother, and admit us to Your grace, for You are the most compassionate of all."

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: O Lord! forgive me and my brother, and cause us twain to enter into Thy mercy, and Thou art the Most Merciful of the merciful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "O my Lord! Forgive me and my brother, and make us enter into Your Mercy, for you are the Most Merciful of those who show mercy."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon Moses said: 'O Lord! Grant forgiveness upon me and my brother and admit us to Your Mercy, for You are most merciful of the merciful.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (Musa) said: "O my Lord! Forgive me and my brother, and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the Most Merciful of those who show mercy."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Lord' said Moses, 'forgive me and forgive my brother. Admit us to Your Mercy, for You are Most Merciful of the merciful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses prayed, "Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy; you are the most Merciful."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses prayed: "O my Lord! forgive me and my brother! admit us to Thy mercy! for Thou art the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: This was the case with the people of Pharaoh and those before them, who rejected the signs of their Lord and were destroyed for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh as they were oppressors.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's folk, and the people before him, who cried lies to the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them because of their sins, and We drowned the folk of Pharaoh; and all were evildoers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Similar to the behaviour of the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), and those before them. They belied the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) for they were all Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Such was the case with the people of Pharaoh, and those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We annihilated them for their wrongs, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh—they were all evildoers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Their case is like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them: they rejected the signs of their Lord as false and so We destroyed them for their sins, and caused the people of Pharaoh to drown. For they were wrong-doers all.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Their way is) as the way of Pharaoh's folk and those before them; they denied the revelations of their Lord, so We destroyed them in their sins. And We drowned the folk of Pharaoh. All were evil-doers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all [of them] were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Like the people of the Pharaoh and those who lived before them, (the unbelievers) rejected the revelations of God. We destroyed them for their sins and drowned the people of Pharaoh. They were all unjust.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and those before them": They treated as false the Signs of their Lord: so We destroyed them for their crimes, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh: for they were all oppressors and wrong-doers.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He that bought him, being of Egypt, said to his wife, 'Give him goodly lodging, and it may be that he will profit us, or we may take him for our own son.' So We established Joseph in the land, and that We might teach him the interpretation of tales. God prevails in His purpose, but most men know not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And he (the man) from Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay comfortable, may be he will profit us or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Yusuf (Joseph) in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah has full power and control over His Affairs, but most of men know not.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The man from Egypt who bought him said to his wife: "Take good care of him, possibly he might be of benefit to us or we might adopt him as a son." Thus We found a way for Joseph to become established in that land and in order that We might teach him to comprehend the deeper meaning of things. Allah has full power to implement His design although most people do not know that.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And he (the man) from Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay comfortable, maybe he will profit us or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Yusuf in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah has full power and control over His affairs, but most of men know not.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And he of Egypt who purchased him said unto his wife: Receive him honourably. Perchance he may prove useful to us or we may adopt him as a son. Thus we established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah was predominant in His career, but most of mankind know not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The man from Egypt who had bought him said to his wife, ‘Give him an honourable place [in the household]. Maybe he will be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son.’ Thus We established Joseph in the land and that We might teach him the interpretation of dreams. Allah has [full] command of His affairs, but most people do not know.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the one from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, "Make his residence comfortable. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a son." And thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most of the people do not know.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Joseph in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and events). And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs; but most among mankind know it not.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So when they had passed further on (beyond that fixed place), Musa (Moses) said to his boy-servant: "Bring us our morning meal; truly, we have suffered much fatigue in this, our journey."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When they had journeyed further on, Moses said to his servant: "Bring us our repast. We are surely fatigued by today's journey."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So when they passed further on, Musa said to his boy-servant: "Bring us our morning meal; truly, we have suffered Nasaban in this, our journey."

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses asked his young companion when they crossed this point, "Bring us our food; the journey has made us tired."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: After they had passed the place, Moses said to his young companion, "Bring us our morning meal; we have indeed been fatigued by this journey."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When they had passed on (some distance), Moses said to his attendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much fatigue at this (stage of) our journey."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "And what about the former generations?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'And what of the former generations?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "What about the generations of old?"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh asked: "Then, what is the state of the former generations?"

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) asked: 'How was it then, with the former generations'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh asked, "What about the previous generations?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous generations?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So We showed Pharaoh all Our signs, but he cried lies, and refused.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We showed him [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] all Our Signs and Evidences, but he denied and refused.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We showed Pharaoh Our Signs, all of them, but he declared them to be false and rejected them.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
